text: Small family style restaurant with delicious food. Chef came out and greeted all patrons which was so nice. Banana foster was served, compliments of the chef. I recommended this place if in the area!

Had he winter salad. It was delicious. What a nice find while here doing a class. The service was wonderful and the ambience is cool. They even brought me a fresh cookie from the chef after my meal. Five stars all the way
Went their rrcently.  Out of towners found this cafe with friendly service and great food.

This place is great. I generally dont write reviews, but I have to give this one five stars. We have been here four times, and every time we were very impressed. Give it a try!  You wont be disappointed.

My wife and I dined here yesterday morning, 2/26, on the last day of a long weekend in Vegas.  We were looking for something off-strip, so we could avoid large crowds, ostentatious buffets and inflated pricing.  I selected Zenaida's on the strength of their Yelp rating, and we were absolutely not disappointed.

Right after we ordered, we were treated to a small plate of house-made chips and "enchilada aioli", compliments of the chef.  Not sure what was in the dip, but it was delicious!

We opted to start with the cinnamon bun, which was an absolute delight.  Warm, sweet and sticky, and piled high with a mound of whipped cream.

My wife enjoyed the Sterling breakfast: two eggs made to order, delicious breakfast potatoes and the thickest, juiciest slab of bacon I'd ever seen.  This was precisely the simple breakfast fare we were after, but done with such a high quality that it easily could have been featured in any of the high-end restaurants on The Strip.

I ordered the Eggs Benedict, which was also fantastic.  Eggs done perfectly (I prefer mine scrambled), the same thick-cut bacon, and a well-balanced Hollandaise sauce made for a delicious treat.  This, too, came with breakfast potatoes, which were crispy and MOLTEN LAVA HOT (seriously, be careful here).

After the meal, the chef sent out a plate of bu√±uelos-esque fried pita chips and whipped cream.  We practically needed to be rolled out of the restaurant.

Prices were extremely modest by Vegas standards, with the full meal for two running just over $30.

The staff at the cafe was friendly and genuinely eager to please.  Service before and during our meal was attentive, with ample refills to my coffee.  There was a slight slump in service when the time came to handle the check, but I am more than willing to let that slide in the face of the excellent experience we had otherwise.

We don't travel to Las Vegas frequently, but I am sure we'll be back here the next time we come around.  In the meantime, please do yourselves a favor and check this place out!

Excellent on all fronts...food, service & price!  We will return and we only have a week before we move!  I had the special, Rock Star blackened Pork loin w/a kicked up (as Emeril would say) hollandaise sauce - my husband had the biscuits & gravy, different but delicious! We had the cinnamon role to start, holy cow, what can I say, it's everything you want a cinnamon bun to be & more! Give it a try East-siders & you West-siders too!
Great place! Delicious food, good music, and very welcoming. Best chocolate chip cookies I ever had!

This is an awesome place. We were searching for something good and casual for our food and away from the all you can eat buffets and found this on yelp. Nice little place, good decor. Food is prepared with lot of care. Even the plates are designed for the dish you order. I like that detail. I had scrambled tofu breakfast. It was really good, ingredients go very well with each other. Very good presentation, and delicious food. Service is very good. Don't be alarmed if the place is not house full, it is away from downtown. It is true to their tag line, "just good food ".

Great food, different from your normal go to breakfast and brunch cafes. It has a beautiful ambiance and more importantly service was amazing! I had the eggplant veggie sandwich. It was delish. Sauce is so tasty:)

Came in for the first time today. I ordered the avocado toast and a side of breakfast potatoes, the husband ordered egg, bacon and potatoes. The avocado toast came with arugula and a balsamic drizzle. It was awesome and just enough food. Didn't need the potatoes, even though they were good. The bacon was thick slab full of smoky flavor! I ordered a cinnamon roll to take home and it was delicious. Chef gave us some warm chocolate chip cookies and they were just perfect. We will be back and will bring people with us. Thank you for the great food!

Wow! I'm not sure there are enough descriptive words in the dictionary for this gem of restaurant. I stopped in after reading reviews, not feeling great and was warmly greeted at the door. Chef made me the most perfect macaroni and cheese. I will be back and often to indulge of the luxuries of taste at this restaurant!

This place is a hole-in-a-wall GEM!!! Amazing staff great atmosphere and of course the FOOD!!! Holy amazing Batman try the corned beef hash chef whim style simply amazing. Hit all the senses and tastebuds not to mention very perfect portion of potato, where others put the hash on a bed of potatoes, they put them as a supporting role!!! You will make a mistake not visiting this place!!!!!
My Kids found this place and brought me a sample of 3 items. Wow was it the best ever eaten. A true gem on the East side of Las Vegas were I have lived for over 50 years. Thank you Chef
I love this place I highly recommended food is great, customer service is the best. Chef is the best

Went on a Sunday morning at about 11 or breakfast. Got right in. Very friendly staff! Service was great as well. We both had the Eggs Benedict and it was perfect! The slab cut bacon was phenomenal! Hollandaise was the best I have ever had! The chef came by to say hello and was extremely friendly and fun to talk to. Worth the trip from the far north side of town! We'll go back. Or hopefully they bring one to the North end!
Burrito built for two.  Head chef very nice.  Good service.  Friendly sax music grew on us.

Second time I've been here, and both times it was out of this world amazing. The food is delicious and plentiful, everything made with exceptional care and quality. Zenaida's is not your run-of-the-mill bfast spot. There are unique items on their menu that you won't find anywhere else and something to please every palate. Even if you don't live on the east side, it's worth the trip.
Not your ordinary restaurant. A good selection of food all prepared in a unique way. Wait staff friendly and on the ball. It offers upscale food at everyday prices.
My family and I keep coming in for breakfast for delicious food and warm hospitality. We love this place!

I was pleased that this place had multiple vegan options, including a tofu scramble and a quinoa vegan burger (I had the tofu scramble and it was tasty!). The chef came out to our table and was super nice, saying that his wife and daughter are vegan. He also mentioned that he cooks the vegan dishes using separate pans, which is a nice bonus. If you're in the Las Vegas area and struggling to find some vegetarian/vegan food, I recommend checking this place out. 

The only reason I didn't give the restaurant five stars is because I reserve that for all-vegan restaurants (I want to promote those compassionate businesses the most), but the food and service at Zenaida's Cafe were excellent.

This place is a hidden gem!!! To start we got the cinnamon roll which is so good, perfectly warmed and sweetened. My husband and I both ordered shrimp and grits and they're phenomenal! My daughter ordered chicken and waffles and it was very juicy and flavorful. The owner/chef came out to check on how our meal was which is a nice touch. The owner then sent us this warm apple berry cobbler dessert which was once again amazing. This place is a must try, we will be back!

I wish we had gotten here sooner!  The food was absolutely fantastic.  Seasoning was terrific and the portion sizes were incredible.  Will absolutely be coming back in the future.  Great service as well!

Amazing food!!! My mom and I had a great breakfast here. The avocado toast is both beautiful and oh sooo tasty (comes in 5 little pieces of toast) great shareable starter. We almost made our own omlete and had the fried chicken/waffle.  All SOOO YUMMY!

Great little breakfast spot, off the beaten-path. 

Wonderful food, nice presentation.    
Inventive and tasty meals. 
The avocado toast doesn't disappoint. 
Inexpensive, unassuming.   Great service. Definitely 
Recommend highly.
Holy cow! This place is a hidden gem! Excellent food, great service, very friendly chef. Highly recommend this place.

This is quickly and justifiably losing its status as a hidden gem. Chef Sterling's charming little restaurant at Pecos and Tropicana is worth the 10 minute drive from the south strip. The food was superb and carefully prepared. My wife noticed that each ingredient of her egg white omelette seemed to have been prepared individually before being incorporated into the omelette. Chef Sterling confirmed that when he came out to chat with us. My bacon was incredible; hand cut from the ham. Everything about the place reflects the chef's commitment to excellence and customer service. If you're a Vegas visitor, do yourself a favour and experience this unique restaurant. If you're a local, I envy you.

Stumbled across this place and I'm oh so glad I did! The Cheesy Shrimp and Grits was heavenly and the service surpassed my greatest expectations. If you have a chance to eat at Zenaida's Cafe take it. You won't be disappointed. 
This is my new go to breakfast spot!

Visited for the first time today with the family and it definitely exceeded my expectations!! Everything was perfect, the delicious food, portion size & customer service! There are so many options on the menu to pick from so anyone can find exactly what they're craving! Definitely my new favorite spot in town.

So good I went right home and figured out my yelp password just so I could spread the word.  

Casual, relaxed setting with service that was that perfect blend of friendly without being in your face.  Incredible food.  Like having comfort food personally prepared by a chef with Michelin stars.  The food takes a little longer to prepare, but you can tell in your first bite that that is because they are just making sure everything is perfect.  And then the bill comes and it costs as much as Denny's.

Delicious food, super nice staff!! Plenty of food to stuff yourself the morning. I got biscuits & gravy, also came with chorizo which was a nice surprise. Added an egg but didn't need it; came with two or 2.5 full biscuits, gravy plentiful but not sloppy at all! Our crew got breakfast burritos that came with totally, chicken & waffles, all very good and more than enough food for hungry, hungover guys.
Loved the food!  Nice take on a turkey burger. Husband loved the Mac N' Cheese. Ready to go back to try something different.

Had a great first meal here yesterday. Pancakes and the best bacon ever. The chef sent over homemade chips and also a desert that was the perfect ending to a great meal. My friend had chicken and waffles, which I tried. Perfect ratios and flavor. 

Ambiance and service was top notch, even have a dog friendly patio. 

You won't be disappointed. You'll be happy,full and writing recommendations!

Okay so tried this place earlier today and it was amazing! I had the shrimp and cheesy grits and Wifey had the omelette. The portions are big and so is the flavor!! We went with a couple of friends who also had the eggs benedict and the sausage monte Cristo. We all enjoyed our meals! The service was also very good! Really enjoyed the complimentary chips. Definitely will be coming back!

Wow!! Awesome service, delicious food, great prices, and great atmosphere.
I understand why this place has 5 stars rating is a hidden gem!! Even the chef came outside to ask if everything was okay and say thank you.Little things like that go along way. My boyfriend and I kept talking about the great experience we had on our way home. Definitely coming back!
Southern Classic menu good family atmosphere enjoyed the food tremendously good job. Love the decor and family that owns place is very friendly

Don't let this place slip by! Everything is fresh and tasty. The variety is great for those looking to eat light, meat free, or do the whole nine yards and stuff your face. The staff is friendly and helpful. It's got a definite mom and pop feel to it. 
The Avocado Toast is the bees knees & the fresh greens are a perfect topper. I got Chloe's Tofu Scrambled, let me tell you what, THEY MAKE TOFU SO STINKING GOOD. My dad got the Fried Chicken and Waffle: it was a HUGE portion and HE LOVED IT LOOOOOOOVED IT. 
The chef even came over and gave us a little sample of his bananas foster and thanked us for coming in! What a sweetheart.

I love biscuits and gravy. It was something I grew up with. Ever since I left home it's been nearly impossible to get biscuits and gravy that didnt tast like stale instant biscuits out of a can lathered with carbonara from a jar. But here at zenaidas, they did something new and delectable. Truly the best Ive had west of Texas.

Definitely a hidden gem! I got the eggs benedict, and my grandma got the breakfast burrito. The food was sooo delicious. We tried the pumpkin spice bread pudding and it was phenomenal! We always had great customer service. Excited to explore the rest of the menu!
This place is amazing. Chef even came out and chatted with us  finally a decent place in our neighborhood. I highly recommend this place!!

The 5-star reviews do not lie. I was worried when I walked in and the place was empty, but the staff was welcoming so I decided to stay. The food is legit. I had the special short rib hash with soft scrambled eggs. It was incredible. Then the chef (and this place has a real chef) sent out a complimentary dessert. I was too stuffed to eat much if it, but it was very good. 

I recommend trying this place soon. Word is going to get out and I predict when I return to Las Vegas in a few months I might have to wait for a table here. They have only been open 6 months but word will spread and this will be become a hot spot. Get there and enjoy before the crowds do.

Stopped in for the first time. Definitely won't be back. They don't know what a country scramble egg is and also think that processed egg wash are real eggs. Garlic is way to over powering to be the only seasoning on potatoes and they don't butter their toast so you get cold toast with butter that is also cold. Not impressed one bit

Finally !   The search is over for the finest breakfast in Henderson/Vegas !!!   
Not only are the prices more than fair,  the service is incredible.   The food is incredible while the chef will make the rounds insuring the customers are happy. 
My son who is vegan was accommodated without fail and I had the amazing eggs benedict for my Fathers Day breakfast,  I cannot say enough about this place other than everyone should celebrate this place and the chef  as the best breakfast in the city.   Its not just a pile if cheese and grease that you cannit finish,   this is a top level meal with great service at reasonable prices.

Decided to try this place after seeing the reviews on yelp. The first person that greeted us was a young girl who was very sweet but, not very attentive.They brought out house made chips First with a bloody Mary aoli. The chips were delicious and crisp and the aoli was very unique and yummy.  We then ordered the zucchini with the garlic aoli which was very tasty. The zucchini was crunchy and fresh which complimented the crispy planko crust well.The garlic aoli on the other hand tasted like plain mayo. I order the Mac and cheese with sausage and my girlfriend ordered corn beef and hash. My Mac and cheese was swimming in grease and cream and was very poorly proportioned. It was a huge bowl of Mac and cheese with 4 little sausages on top. And it did not have good flavor at all. My girlfriends corn beef and hash was delicious. The eggs were poached perfectly but, it was a large quantity. It was enough for 2 people. The customer service was not very great. The two people on the floor walked past us several times without asking us if we needed anything even tho we were clearly just sitting there waiting. There was an older lady that was not friendly and when my girlfriend smiled at her she gave her a dirty look. They gave us complementary cookies which were tasty but, the presentation was messy. Overall this place had a good start and good end but, just got a little messy in the middle.

My wife had the waffles and said they were the best she ever ate. I had the corned beef hash, with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. It was so damn delicious. Too bad I live in New Jersey or I would be eating there everyday. The chef even gave us a complimentary plate of cookies and cream which were freaking out of this world! If you are in Vegas and you don't go, you're missing out big time!
Excellent food here!  Hidden in a small strip mall!  Great service and even met the Chef!  Definitely coming back!! YUM!

Man this place is bomb as hell. I've never heard of it before today but I'll definitely be back with more people. I ordered the biscuits and gravy and it was by far the best that I've ever had. Tell yo friends about this place. It's amazing. The chef is super cool too

Chloe wanted pancakes and we were across town, a side we rarely travel to. We searched "pancakes" near our "current location" and Zenaida's Cafe popped up. 5 stars and about 150 reviews?!  Hmmmmmm...our curiosity was sparked! 

We pulled up. It looked like a little "homemade" Italian restaurant from out front. 

We walked in, and I was utterly confused.  The decor definitely throws you off.  There's this colorful tile that really doesn't do much for the space, and an awkward lounge spot right near the front door with fake fruit in a bowl and everything. Hmmmmm....

The tables are not very inviting...the overall look of the restaurant is not really enticing. If it didn't have 5-Stars, we would have walked out before we even sat down.  There must be something about the food or Yelp has really done us wrong! 

We were seated in a 2-top off to the side of the room.  The waiter came by to take our drink orders.  I requested a decaf coffee and he quickly responded "it's instant!" I scrunched up my nose and politely declined.  "We will just take a water then..." This place is not off to a good start.  I didn't know restaurants would ever serve instant coffee in this day & age haha! 

We couldn't quite decide what to get. For me, the menu is really limited.  A lot of bacon / pork / beef options but I don't eat any of those things.  I settled for the basic breakfast with 2 eggs, turkey sausage, breakfast potatoes and English muffin (even though I can't eat gluten). They don't have gluten-free options.  Chloe ordered the waffle. 

As we waited for our meal, the waitress brought over a pail of homemade chips with garlic aioli. THEY WERE SO GOOD.  Thin, not overly crispy, and seasoned to perfection.  The aioli was good, but it wasn't needed. The chips were amazing as a stand-alone. 

Our food was served quickly.  My eggs were perfect.  I was actually really impressed with how perfectly "over medium" they were.  Turkey sausage was just OK.  You can't really rate an English muffin. They are always good haha! 

Chloe's waffle, on the other hand, was INCREDIBLE.  The waffle itself was fluffy, thick and served to the perfect texture. It was covered with homemade whipped cream that I think was sprinkled with cinnamon.  There were fresh cut strawberries covering the top of the waffle.  It was soooooooo good.  She didn't use any of the syrup provided. The whipped cream was just the perfect sweetness to compliment the waffle. On the side, Chloe opted for the thick-cut bacon. She said it was amazing. 

After our meal, they brought out some homemade cookies complements of the chef. The cookies were topped with their homemade whipped cream. The cookies were warm and delicious.  We took 2 to go, shared one at the table.  Wow. 

The service was decent. The chef came out to touch tables before we were served, but had he come out after we ate, I would have thanked him for such a perfect meal.  With all of the chain restaurants and stuck-up chefs on the strip that just leave their name on the marquee while rarely making an appearance, I appreciated the fact that this chef came out to greet his guests and ask how everything is tasting. 

I'm not sure if/when we can go back because it's clear across town, but this place deserves the 5 star rating it has.  Don't be thrown off by the decor.  It's really not an issue if the food is THAT delicious!

I had the chopped salad with vinaigrette dressing and I added a blackened piece of salmon. The salad it's self was delicious, you can tell that they use fresh and good quality vegetables and greens. The salmon was seasoned perfectly and not fishy at all. I got mine to go and it was still just as I would've had it in the restaurant. The service was great. A little bit pricey, my salad ended up being $15 with The salmon added, but well worth it for the quality. Will definitely be going back

Really surprised by how good this little place was. The server was accommodating in the best way.  The food was interesting and seasoned well and fully without being hidden in salt.  Lots of vegetarian options, but my chicken was likewise excellent; they even brought a free cookie with a salt cream. 

I wish we lived closer as we'd be back all the time; as it is though we will definitely be making the trek more and maybe catch a movie in the process.

Not only is the food great here, the hospitality is off the charts. They made great efforts to provide us the best breakfast accommodating for my allergies. The complementary dessert was the best I have had at any breakfast place. I would give them 10 stars if I could.

We found this place on yelp and decided to try it because of the reviews. Wow, it exceeded our expectations. Every single staff member was so attentive and the chef even came out after our meal to ask about our experience. I ordered Chloe's tofu scrambled and it was sooo good. This place is definitely a gem! I recommend for locals and out of towners. We had a one year old baby with us too they went above and beyond to accommodate us.

We went to Zenaida's for breakfast as a result of their first review and we were not disappointed! This nicely decorated restaurant has the opportunity to become one of those neighborhood "go to" places for breakfast and lunch.  They offered an excellent selection of items that are priced well for the quality and quantity of food.  I selected an omelette and was able to choose the ingredients to customize it to my taste.  I was presented with perfectly prepared breakfast including excellent potatoes, toast and a side of fruit.  The quality of the ingredients was top notch including an a very tasty thick piece of applewood bacon adorning the top. Nice touch and very flavorful.  Please do yourself and the neighborhood a favor and try this restaurant. I would love to see them to grow and expand to dinner.

This is an eclectic little cafe that is best described as a fine dine comfort food. The chef as worked at some of the great restaurants on the strip and it shows. But his caring and concern for his customers come across in every bite of food. Most especially in the little desserts that are passed out at the end of your meal. As great as what I ordered tasted, this was heaven. Prepared by the chef's wife, this is shows that this is clearly a family run business. All hands on deck. 
I suggest everyone in the area give them a try, because this hidden gem deserves our support.

Amazing food. Myself and my family came here during brunch hours and were pleasantly surprised at the quality and taste of all of our meals. The sausage biscuits and gravy were excellent-I especially loved the spice of the hot link. The Monte Christo was excellent as well. 

Definitely a must go to restaurant if your trying to escape all the hustle and bustle of downtown Vegas

Went here randomly for breakfast because of the awesome reviews. The staff was so friendly. The chef came out and checked on each guest to ensure the food was on point, which it was! They also gave us complimentary cookies at the end that were warm, gooey, and yummy. I saved one for later thinking it would be pretty hard 6 hours following, but it was still moist and delicious. Thank you guys and gals very much for great food and service!!

Delicious food and the service was excellent. We came with our kids and they had coloring books with crayons. The chef came out and chatted with our kiddos. The avocado toast was absolutely delicious! My kids got the tofu scramble and loved it. Will definitely be back again.

I was totally impressed with all the  food served to our party of 5, it not only look good but i every morsel we ate was full of taste. 



This is now my favorite restaurant..


Thank you,

Absolutely amazing good and hospitality! We tried the biscuits and gravy, the Monte Cristo, and one of the blackened pork chop specials. Every bite was divine. 
They are an amazing team - family run and well run at that. 

Thank you Chef for stopping by our table!

Looking forward to breakfast because Zenaida's had such great reviews.  Small place.  A couple tables open.  Seemed like one group ahead of us.  One of the staff asked us to wait.  After waiting quite a while, it appeared we were supposed to put our name in.  We put our name in.  Waited some more.   After 20 minutes of looking at empty tables and no communication, we went to IHOP across the street.  The Swedish crepes were delicious.

Found this amazing little treasure near work and tried it out for lunch. It was like stepping into a combination diner/someone's living room. The service was excellent, it was quiet but food seemed to move swiftly through the kitchen. The chef even stepped out to make sure we were enjoying the meal. I ordered the garlic rosemary fries, which were delicious, and a very large serving. I also had the avocado toast, served with a side salad and topped with tomatoes and pickled onions that brightened it up. My friend ordered the corned beef hash and enjoyed it. After the meal we were served pumpkin spiced bread pudding as a gift from the chef. It was amazing!
I Enjoyed this place Much Better than Dennys I'm Glad I came Here Nice Music and The Food was Awesome.I Shall Return when I'm in Town

Why is it that whenever I decide to go eat by myself, service is nonexistent? I think I should be getting proper service even if I'm by myself, or did I miss a memo? Anyways, came here to eat lunch on my own and got seated, I got my drink and food order taken. After my food was dropped off, it was like I was invisible! No one came to check up on me, asked me for a refill, nothing!! The chef came out to greet the other tables and talk about the restaurant. With me? No, he just passed right by me, glanced at me and kept walking. Server dropped of check, I didn't even bother to ask for refill or anything because I just wanted to leave at that point. I didn't know where to pay so I just left it on the table. Food was good, it's just a shame that I can't go out to eat by myself without getting bad service.

We've been going to Zenaida's for about a year now and have made our way through about half of the menu and most of the specials they offer and have loved every meal. The staff always makes you feel welcome and the chef has come out to say Hi every time we've been there. The fact that we've been given a free warm cookie dessert at every visit doesn't hurt either. The only complaint I have is that I wish there were a few more healthier and lighter options. Sometimes we choose to eat other places because we're just not in the mood for such a heavy meal. But that's about me, not them. Everything they do they do perfectly.
Amazing place to eat! Food is delicious and the staff is very friendly. The chef is a sweetheart and has given us complimentary cookies everything we've gone.
Absolutely amazing breakfast.  Everything ordered was cooked perfectly and was delicious.  The avocado toast was delicious and this will be my favorite Las Vegas brunch spot.

Hidden gem! The food is absolutely delicious. I loved the great service and the way they kept checking up on us making sure we were fine. I got free coffee when I mentioned Yelp. I wanted to order more food from the menu because everything looked so good. I decided to get the Eggs Benedict and couldn't be more happier with my decision. My girlfriend got the Sausage Monte Christo and let me try it. Both plates are very tasty and fill you up. There was no more room in my stomach for more food even though I wanted to try more things. I'll be back for then though. I highly recommend this place to anyone. The service really deserves 5-stars. Can you believe the chef came out to say thank you for stopping by and he hoped we liked the food. AND... we even got a dessert for free. What else could you ask from a restaurant? Come here!! You will not be disappointed. :)

Shrimp and grits and a side of eggs were GREAT! However the side of bacon I ordered was entirely too thick. I'm a bacon lover and crispy bacon is life. Please invest in regular bacon and cook it crispy and you got a forever customer!

Highly recommended breakfast. Will have to come back for lunch. Great vibe and very clean. We had the Tremaine's Biscuits and Gravy and Avocado and Heirloom tomato egg whites omelette. 

Many interesting dishes on the menu. Guess it will be a while until we try hem all.

My boyfriend and I love getting brunch. It's the one thing in life worth getting up early for.

Zenaida's was a great pick because they have dishes for meat eaters and some vegetarian choices, as well. I'm talking well thought out items, not the usual afterthought dishes that you get from most establishments. 

I was torn between the scrambled tofu dish with rice and the breaded/fried eggplant lettuce cups. I ended up ordering a dish off the weekly specials list, the Vegan Stack. Grilled onions and shredded potatoes were layered with two jerk-rubbed, grilled tofu steaks. Chopped tomatoes and red onion topped the stack for a good mix of raw and cooked veggies. Everything was well seasoned and full of flavor. The jerk spice made that dish. 

During our meal, the chef stepped out to greet and thank us for joining them for breakfast. Along with the service from our sweet server, I'd say they provided us with an excellent overall dining experience. 

After our meal, we were presented with two warm chocolate chip cookies, adorned with whipped cream and caramel drizzle, compliments of the chef. I cannot think of a sweeter gesture than this. The cookies were just the way I like them, soft and chewy; simple and comforting, all at once. The care and attention we received felt like we were dining at a family member's home. This little gem is the perfect reason to support local, independent businesses.

Holy f****** s*** this place is the s***. Who knew biscuits and gravy would taste so gourmet. Very nice retro and groovy place. Nice jazz music in the background and wonderful employees. Every time I've been there the chef has always came out and greeted us. Free dessert occasionally too!
The food was amazing! My father has dietary restrictions and the chef made him something special off the menu with eggplant and seafood. The chef was wonderful and accommodating.

We wanted to find agood place for breakfast and guess what? We did. My waffle was excellent and the bacon was center cut. Hubby said his was good too.Fantastic  friendly service. The chef personally came out and thanked us for coming in. We left with smiles. Will be back.

This place is open and spacious yet feels like you're warmly in grandma's kitchen.  The waiter was so helpful and sweet. We received complimentary homemade potato chips, they were perfect! Hubby got the pork stack and OMG, it was so flavorful. I had a special omelette with herb cheese,  wilted spinach and carmelized tomatoes.  I loved it! The chef came out and greeted us and we got complimentary warm cookies at the end of our meal.  What a wonderful brunch!

This place is LEGIT!  

We were skeptical at first since we came in to an entirely empty dining room, but it was 10am on a weekday,...

Ambiance is nice, service on point, and the food,.. well like the sign out front says... it's just GOOD!

Burgers were seriously bomb!  Bacon was real deal!

Definitely coming back!

Oh my gosh, it was absolutely delicious! We tried the avocado toast, my husband and I LOVED it! I also ate the cheesy grits with Shrimp, never had grits before, but WOW! That dish was so delicious and full of flavor! My husband also had the eggs benedict, it was perfect! And can I just say that the bacon was so thick, like it was cut straight off the slab, and cooked to perfection. Our kids enjoyed the Collins Breakfast Burger and the pancakes with eggs and bacon, both said it was the best they ever had! We will definitely eat here again before we leave!

One of the best breakfast and lunch places in Vegas.  The customer service from the servers to the chef is top notch.  The food is amazing and the specials are worth trying! Can't wait to go back to try some of the other dishes I saw other people eating.

This cafe is so cute! My friends and I wanted to go eat out for breakfast since we had time, so we decided to go here. I don't usually like breakfast, but my food (the eggs benedict) was soooo good! We also has a cinnamon roll, which was big enough for three of us to share. I especially like the end when they gave us complementary cookies. I would def come again!!

Avocado toast and a giant, fresh salad on the East side? Zenaida's was an unexpected find, to say the least. The avo toast is a must-order, combining garlic bread and the trendy healthy breakfast dish to excellent results, with a small salad that makes the $8 "appetizer" easily suitable as a meal. The Cobb salad is traditionally prepared, adding some oomph with a cilantro ranch.

Location has a variety of seating options, and plenty of attentive staff. Food came out a bit slowly, so maybe call ahead if you are coming in on a short lunch break. Portions are large and all of the produce was super-fresh, which is hard to find on this side of town for anything but Mexican food. Looking forward to coming back to try their quinoa burger!

The food is absolutely amazing! If I could marry the avocado smothered toast, I would. The staff is extremely friendly and fast. The cook even came out to check how we we're doing. The best little hole in the wall I have found here in town. Needless to say, I plan on hitting this place weekly!!!! Try the breakfast burrito

Walking in to the restaurant you're greeted with homey decor. This gives a feeling of nostalgia like walking into grandma's house knowing you're about to eat well. The menu has a great selection ranging from daily made cinnamon rolls to clam chowder. We stumbled upon this place after an eye appointment and I'm glad my eye doctor is close by so it'll be a little treat to myself every time I get my eyes picked and prodded. I had the chicken and waffles while my husband built his own omelet. The food was delicious! After we had our meal they even gave us complimentary apple cobbler. Such a treat coming from such a cookie cutter town like Las Vegas it's nice to know that there's a hole in the wall that delivers excellent service and mouthwatering food!

Went in for breakfast. A friend had the standard breakfast burrito and I substituted the meat for chicken. My friend said his was okay but I thought mine was excellent. The restaurant was very clean and they had relevant music playing in the background. They even have a jukebox. The staff was very friendly and the chef came out to our table to thank us. Only complaint is that there was no indication the hash browns would come with scallions  in it. We were given two complimentary cookies that were out of this world.

Wow! I am beyond impressed with this place. 
Came here for brunch on a Sunday afternoon, and I was sooo hungry. I was seated quickly & asked for a recommendation as it was my first time. Decided on the tofu scramble w nori, rice, & slaw. It was SO good, and made in a different way than the standard tofu scramble every other vegan friendly place makes. The flavors were amazing! 
The chef also brought out a vegan rice pudding for me that was out of this world. He was very friendly, and I could tell he truly cares about his business and customers. 
I had a great experience here and will definitely return.

Amazing customer service and food! The Mac and cheese was out of this world, definitely add the jalapeno bacon slab. My husband had the breakfast burger, and his eyes lit up like christmas morning when he bit into that baby. Already anticipating our next visit. 10 out of 10 I would recommend!

Zero question in my mind as to why this place has 5 stars on 196 reviews. I went in this morning with 2 coworkers around 930. There were no other patrons in the restaurant at the time which could be alarming. 

I went with the chicken and waffles on the favorites portion of the menu. The waffle was dense yet not dry. The chicken was very well seasoned and tasty. My only complaint is that I wish they gave a little more chicken for the price. 

My buddies got bacon and eggs breakfast plates. The bacon was possibly the thickest bacon I've ever seen. I didn't get to taste it but they both noted that it was delicious. 

The server was very nice and attentive. When we were finished, the chef sent out a small treat on the house- pumpkin bread pudding. It was absolutely delicious. 

I'd go back here any day and it's close to my office so I know I'll be back again. 

Give it a go!

We loved our brunch at Zenaida's! This cafe has excellent food, with a real deal chef -hat and all- visible from an open window into the kitchen. 

We enjoyed a monstrous cinnamon roll, prepared with whipped cream, fresh berries, and caramel - YUM. Next was a monte cristo breakfast sandwich that had a spicy mayo and delicious chorizo. Our other entree was the tofu scramble, which was INCREDIBLE. Perfectly oily, seasoned, and an excellent blend of veggies, tofu, and rice. The chef sent out complimentary fire roasted pumpkin bread pudding to finish our meal, which was a perfect, thoughtful gesture - and very yummy! All the food was presented exceptionally well. 

Service was excellent, with two servers helping us out, each with friendly recommendations and attentiveness. 

The restaurant itself was very clean, colorful, and cute, with booths and tables, as well as a comfy couch/coffee table area and a couple of outside tables as well. 

Thanks for a lovely experience!

If you need breakfast, come here! I'm in Vegas visiting a friend. While she does her regularly scheduled work during the day, i try to find ways to keep myself occupied. After she left this morning, I decided I wanted to find a breakfast spot near her place. So, I came to Yelp and found this place. Zenaida's Cafe is amazing! The staff are wonderful! My server always made sure I had what I needed, the chef came out to check on the diners, and the hostess(?) seemed really cheery. The food is delicious and the restaurant makes you feel at home. They definitely have some regulars that frequent the place and I wish I lived here full-time so I could be one of them! This has honestly been one of my best Yelp finds and I'm so happy to have stumbled upon it!

Outstanding food. So surprising ! Pleasant bright, colorful interior. Jazz /fusion type music in the background suit the decor. Greens for the avocado toast were delicious and seasoned differently than salad for other dishes. Delighted to see a fresh ripe fig on my plate. Also offers vegetarian dishes and I'll skip the quinoa burger and try the tofu dish next time. Complimentary cookies, but we would have highly rated Chef Sterling and this establishment anyway. . Agree w good customer service- our service was great. 

We encountered this unassuming restaurant and are glad we did. Now it is your turn.

This place is a hidden gem! My boyfriend and I loved it! The staff was so nice and friendly. The chef even came out to see how we liked the food! We cinnamon roll was amazing along with the breakfast burrito! We will be coming back for sure!
Looking for a breakfast place to eat at besides casinos and hit the jackpot. Food is fabulous the staff is great

What a gem!!  Was in the area around lunchtime and went on Yelp to find a nearby restaurant. Zenaida's Cafe came up and looked interesting-it WAS & the food was delicious!  Ordered a hamburger and was asked , "How pink do you want it?"  It was prepared perfectly with crispy fries, a thick sliced pickle, and tomato. I will be back to sample many more yummy sounding dishes.  I mentioned to the owner/chef that next time I would try the avocado toast - to my surprise, Chef Sterling prepared an order for me!

This place was perfect for breakfast. Great atmosphere, food and music -- and the hospitality was more than I bargained for. I love eggs Benedict, so that's just what I ordered. Cooked to perfection with homemade hollandaise sauce, thick cut bacon and the poached eggs were perfect. My daughter ordered the Asian chicken salad which she also enjoyed. Homemade potato chips were served compliments of the chef and to finish off the meal we were also served warm chocolate chip cookies drizzled with a caramel sauce and powdered sugar. Yum! And they play contemporary jazz while you're enjoying your meal.  If you're looking to get away from the crowded strip while on vacation, this is the place to be.
Good suprise!! Great food and great service!!Highly recommend. I will definitely come back again!!

Enjoyed breakfast for the first time on 01/20/18 and we were pleasantly surprised by this great little breakfast joint in our hood!

We were given complimentary homemade potato chips with aioli (really aioli, not just commercial mayonnaise mixed with stuff) upon arrival/after ordering and they were pretty good. We ordered shrimp and grits, biscuits and gravy, and chicken and waffles. The grits were sooo cheesy (just the way we like 'em) and the gravy was delicious and made the dish rich. Biscuits were fluffy and although the gravy had a different taste than what we were accustomed to (a little sweet with some seasoning I didn't recognize), the spicy sausage really made the dish come together and balanced out the sweetness of the gravy. The waffle was fluffy and moist, not hard and dry like a lot of other places! The chicken was lightly battered and had great flavor, too. Also loved the caramel sauce on top of the chicken and waffles.

After our meals were finished, they brought out complementary fresh baked cookies-- honestly as a pregnant woman this sealed the deal for me to return! They were still warm from the oven, soft, and gooey. 

Thank you, we will be back!!!!

This little neighborhood restaurant is a treasure.  Found it on Yelp and it lived up to its five star billing. Took my wife and five sons here last Saturday morning before hitting the casinos. My oldest sons both had breakfast burritos that were huge and delicious.  Two other sons had fried chicken and waffles.  I tried their waffles and they were delicious. Another son and I had eggs and thick sliced bacon and wheat toast and everything was great, especially the bacon, which seemed freshly cut from a slab of pork belly. My wife got a mammoth sweet roll. The service was excellent. The chef did come out to talk to us and we also got the complimentary strawberry shortcake.  This will be our go-to breakfast place from now on.

My husband asked me this morning "where is your favorite breakfast place?", to which I replied "I don't really have one"...well I do now! This place is great! Great service, great food, you can tell the chef takes his job seriously! I had the avocado toast with a side of potatoes, and my husband had the salmon plate...all was well prepared and delicious!
Awesome food, service...chef and the staff were great!! Thank you for all the extra treats too

Delicious! First time trying it here. Cafe is super welcoming and everyone is very friendly. We had the biscuit and gravy with no added egg and the egg Benedict. So so yummy. I also ordered the coffee it was delicious. Thank you to the chef for the surprise chocolate chip cookies!! So nice.

My boyfriend & I really felt welcomed at Zenaida's. The staff's very friendly especially the Chef. He's very hospitable. He took the time to walk to each table & made sure we were happy with the food. My boyfriend's a vegan & he was excited to see vegan options on the menu. We were both very satisfied with our meals.

A friend told us about Zenaida's with glowing reviews.  We then checked it out here on Yelp and almost every review was 5 stars, so we had to try it for breakfast/lunch.  A little hidden gem of a place, tough to find but worth it.  Many things on the menu interested us.  I had the eggs benedict which was as good and she had a special of brie omelete.  Very unique and good.

I know that seems enough for many to give them 5 stars but while the meal was good, the service fast and courteous it was not so outstanding but well worth trying.  Next time I am getting chicken and waffles.

We came here for breakfast. The server was really funny. They give you homemade chips and the dipping sauce was really good. They have lots of things on their menu. At the end they gave us a complimentary dessert that was delicious!  I will definitely come here again for breakfast.

At a loss for words.  This is EXACTLY what we have been missing on the East Side. Lovely Family owned/operated,  Food with Real Ingredients cooked by people who love food! I will be back again and again.  I will support and promote it because I want to be eating here 30 years from now!!!  Food 5 stars. Service 5 stars. Love love love it!
We had the avocado toast and eggplant stacks!! So yummy! The eggplant doesn't have bread so it's a nice low carb option. Cute little cafe for a quick and delicious breakfast.
This was my 1st time here, I'm a big  Biscuit and gravy person, this was the best I ever had. So much flavor, this dish can feed two.   The customer service was great and love the environment.
Outstanding. Best chicken and waffles I've had. They treat their guest like kings..Chocolate chip cookie AWESOME.

My wife and I were delighted to find this local gem!  As breakfast fanatics, we routinely scour yelp for new and interesting places, and Zenaidas easily makes the cut. A great number of delicious entrees was available, we enjoyed Salmon Bagel Plate, Z's Montecristo and a Bacon Benedict - all of which were outstandingly good and generously proportioned.  We're already plotting our return!

Amazing!! This was a last minute decision after finding out there was a 45min wait at the hotel restaurant.  So we headed east on Tropicana finding a restaurant near the airport.  Zenaida's popped up and there was no wait for our party of eight.  All our orders came out nice, hot and delicious. Bookmarked the place when we come for our next visit... Definitely a return is required, especially with our Vegan friends. Thanks Chef for the delish bread pudding... What a way to end a brunch!
Found on Yelp. GREAT breakfast! 5 of us and we all had something different. Everyone said that theirs was awsome!
Very small tucked away place but was a very nice experience. Food was quality and delicious and gave have us warm cookies after. Chef care out and checked on us as well.

Wow, totally deserving of 5 stars!  We got the Eggs Benedict and the Corned Beef Hash and both were absolutely delicious.  The coffee was hot and our server kept it filled.  She was polite, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu.  The chef came out to ask each guest about their experience and thanked them for coming in.  They even served us free chips/dip as an appetizer and free shortcake dessert with whipped cream and berries!

I was invited to Zenaida for breakfast/lunch with a few of my choir members. I had the best corned beef hash I've ever eaten hands down. My eyes tasted the food before it hit my mouth. We all enjoyed our dishes I was the only one that ventured away from the chicken and waffles and cheesy grits but all was cooked to perfection. They even brought a small bucket of russet potato chips with a garlic aioli dipping sauce. If I could give them 10 stars I would

Not sure what hype is about? The pancakes were too thick and flavorless. Thick cut tomato for bagel with lox. Coffee cup was dirty and why does everyplace have to have a tv on? Being generous with 3 stars....
Chef and his entire staff are awesome. I have been back there several times, and I have never been disappointed with my food!!! Great Job! I will see you soon...

Perfectly cooked. The potatoes were crisp, the poached eggs bled out like they're supposed, and when my plate was cleaned, the waitress brought out a cookie, compliments of the chef. In short, a local chef who cares and a refreshingly friendly staff.

Here in Vegas on vacation and this restaurant was amazing! The food was so good but more than that I appreciated the staff. Our waiter was great and the chef even came out to ask everyone how our food was which added a really special feel. I would definitely check this place out!

This place is awesome! Great ambiance, delicious food, and a great presentation. The chef came out and spoke to us, this is a great locally owned and operated place! We loved the food - the bacon was good, but we like crispy bacon better than slab bacon. Maybe give the option?

I'm eating my biscuits and gravy as I write this. I've never started a Yelp review between bites of food, but this is an emergency. The world and Las Vegas need to know that there is comfort food greatness in our midst. The breakfast dish in front of me is the best of its kind I've ever tasted - and the most visually appealing. Don't run. Don't walk. Fly to this place. Beam yourself. Finds like this are why there is a Yelp.

This place is a diamond in the rough! Once word gets out, it's going to be packed. The food is simply delicious.  The flavors are unique and well worth coming back for. They start you off with homemade chips that are crisp and addicting. We had the Tofu scramble and the corn beef hash Benedict. They even finish you off with a tasty treat before you leave. 
We're coming back for sure.
delicious, great service and the special compliments of the chef app and desserts were to die for.  definitely will be back and definitely worth the drive from iron mtn/jones!

Great food, great service, my wife order Benedict eggs, she never said and she was never asked too how she wanted them, so she didn't like them, but the chef was asking on every table how was the food and he made them again for her, it was really nice of him. That makes you feel how they care about customer, we are definitely going back.

My daughter and I came in a couple days ago and it was amazing. Everything was delicious and the chef sent out some complimentary items that were beyond delicious. We will definitely go back there every chance we get to go for breakfast/brunch!

Just don't expect to have a slab of bacon on your eggs Benedict all I got was a thin slice of Canadian Bacon. I did like the hollandaise sauce and my husband liked his huge pancakes and the tater tots. I would have preferred breakfast potatoes. They don't tell you of the changes to their menu. You also have to ask for coffee refills. Don't expect equal treatment between tables some get offered a refill others right next do not. Some get service others don't. Some get special treatment and others don't.
Great food and such a friendly environment. The service was great .Clean dining area and  clean bathrooms. Chief comes out and talks to the costumers and even gave us fresh baked cookies!
The Eggs Benedict were delicious and  Service was excellent and personalized with the chef visiting with each guest to ensure their satisfaction.  We will be visiting this restaurant again soon!

Best breakfast I remember having in a while! Avo toast is a must. Chicken and waffles amazing. The salsa with the omelette was really good. Great coffee, too. Chef was adorable. 

I think it's nice to get off the strip where parking doesn't suck and there aren't so many people and driving here is worth it, yum!

Me and my husband are regulars at Zenaida's. We have had a variety of dishes and we have a hard time picking a favorite. We often just find ourselves ordering one of their specials which are always phenomenal. The chef is amazing and knows what he is doing! I also have the added complication of having to eat gluten free and they have been very accommodating. This cafe is a place you don't want to miss. Love it!

Best local brunch spot here in Vegas.  Great food, great service and def a hidden gem.  Imo it beats all the fancy breakfast spots on the strip.  Chef Sterling was the head chef at Wynn no wonder the food presentation and flavor is on point.  Highly recommended and we are def coming here every time we are in town.

What a great neighborhood restaurant.  Chef clearly knows what he is doing.  Had the shrimp and grits, Mac and cheese and the pork stack.  Great food, and had a great neighborhood feel to the restaurant that was very welcoming.

The food was delicious.  I had the Mac and Cheese with Sausage....5 types of cheese...mmm so good and Fried Garlic and Rosemary potatoes.  DELICIOUS....yes lots of carbs but so worth it.  Love the service and even met the co owner Zenaida what a lively woman.  Please support local restaurateurs in this competitive market.  This is a gem of a place.  Came all the way from Tucson, Az and it was so worth it!

Seriously if you like a friendly environment in which to eat your comfort food, please roll on in here. If you want brunch or lunch, I say challenge yourself and eat locally. Yep support small business owners. 
That's being done downtown, but it takes loyal clientele to keep the doors open off the strip. 
Did I mention a grilled outside on this spinach tortilla for the fluffy egg filled breakfast burrito. Served with perfectly cubed, seasoned, deep fried potatoes!!

Saw this place in the Weekly. A bit of a drive and hard to find. Be sure you ask for the homemade potato chips. I had eggs Benedict on a bed spinach. Thick cut pork belly that reminded me of France. Way to good to be in a strip mall. The whiskey soaked bred pudding should labeled a controlled substance! Will definitely come back. *****
Ray

Gotta love it when the chef personally meets and greets his dining guests after he cooks the meal! Not that I needed any changes made to my order, but I'm sure he'd be willing to accommodate to any modifications. His eggs benedict was one of the best I've ever had for breakfast, and I think I'll be skipping lunch and possibly dinner too because of how filling the meal was. The eggs were perfectly poached the way I liked (meaning that when I popped the center with my fork, the yolk gushed out in all its glorious-gooey creaminess), and even though I prefer thin bacon, the thicker and meatier bacon that came with the eggs was very flavorful.  The side of breakfast potatoes were just as tasty, lightly salted, and slightly crisp.  I wish I didn't have to wait a several more hours for my stomach to digest before I can dig into the homemade cinnamon roll that I also ordered to-go... Look for Zenaida's Cafe right next to the State Farm insurance office.  The outside of the cafe doesn't really stand out among the other businesses in the shopping plaza where it's located, but the food inside sure does!  Support the small chef-owned eateries and give Zenaida's cafe a try!

Sooo, a few weeks later... I went back to grab just a small lunch of chicken wings and a side of fries, but my 'quickie' lunch turned into a mini feast of 2 generous portions of freshly cooked fries (I didn't know plain fries came with my order of wings, but the garlic rosemary fries were too tempting to pass up), 7 pieces of succulent, Southern style wings with hot sauce and homemade bbq sauce on the side, and an unexpected complimentary cookies n cream (thank-you-Chef-for-ruining-my-diet) dessert which I gladly made extra room for in my already full stomach!  Next time, I'll be ordering the cookies n cream to go because otherwise, I won't have the stomach space to sample everything else on the menu!

Wow! This is definitely a hidden gem! The food here is delicious! 

Ambiance: Super casual! It feels like walking into grandmas house for breakfast. The decor is all types of mixed and super comfy/inviting. 

Service: It was good. We spoke to 3 different people during our visit. First was the young lady who came to take our drink orders. She wasn't very friendly and seemed annoyed/ in a hurry. My mom asked a question about the menu and she was pretty short with her. Looked like she was in a big hurry but there were only 4 other parties at the restaurant with us. Our server was a nice guy! He was professional and took care of us, also had a little sense of humor which brightened up the mood! Last, the chef personally came out and asked how our food was which was a huge plus, he was so sweet and you can tell he genuinely cares about what he does and puts a lot of love into it.

Food: Everything was delicious! We started off with the avocado toast, the toast was crunchy on the outside soft and fluffy on the inside, the flavor, presentation and composition were incredibly amazing making this one of my favorite dishes! For my entree I ordered the Eggs Benedict with potatoes and everything was amazing! The tick cut bacon was my favorite part but it's definitely a classic dish I recommend. My mom ordered the tofu scramble and she loved it, it was a good size to share! For dessert we ordered the cinnamon roll and wow! It was soft, warm, and creamy with fresh fruit and a delicious icing on top. Last we're the freshly baked cookies. The ooey gooey delicious baked and delivered from heaven chocolate chip cookies. Y'all I'm not kidding these were the best, with a caramel drizzle and whipped cream. I'm telling you, you'll love it! 

Extras: I heard they have a special menu Friday nights! You need to get on their email list but this is so awesome! Bathroom was also nice and clean with cute decorations.

I am not going to lie - I wasn't thrilled with my food experience. Today was finally the day that I went out on a limb and broke my keto diet. After reading all of the great Yelp reviews, I decided to give Zenaida's a shot.

I ordered Tremaine's Biscuits & Gravy. I have found a great love for freshly baked buttery biscuits in flavorful country gravy in recent months. And unfortunately, I found today's dish to be lacking in flavor. The biscuits were dry and the country gravy tasted like it was missing something. I added a little salt in hopes that it would bring the flavors to life; however, that did not work out as I was hoping. The dish came with four sausages - which were very flavorful and easily my favorite part of the dish. In my opinion, it was short of average and not worth the $10 price tag.

I had very high hopes for Zenaida's after reading all the amazing Yelp reviews and I ended up a little disappointed. I would definitely be willing to give Zenaida's Cafe a second chance - but maybe next time a different dish...

We were delighted to find another locals spot here in Vegas! The food was good, the service was fantastic, and the restaurant itself is cute with an inviting atmosphere. They even gave us 2 warm chocolate chip cookies with whip cream compliments of the chef at the end of our meal! Definitely coming back to Zenaida's Cafe the next time we're in Vegas.

Wow! What a wonderful find, thanks Yelp.

In town visiting family, searched for a breakfast place and hit the jackpot with Zenaida's. 

Nice, strong coffee. Great start. 

When I couldn't decide between two dishes, Eric did a nice job helping me to choose.
Awesome food! We both totally enjoyed both meals.

Hubby ordered the Collins Breakfast Burger. So yummy!. He described it as one of the best breakfasts he has had in a long time. Delicious homemade burger. Everything about the burger was just so good. Carmelized onions, medium burger, over easy eggs all done right.

I went with the Sausage Monte Cristo. While I'd argue it wasn't really a Monte Cristo as it wasn't deep fried, it was delicious. The spicy house chicken sausage had a kick to it and the ham was so tasty. Served on a toasted baguette, this was a really nice breakfast sandwich. 

Overall, a great experience and highly recommend to all my Vegas friends.
Just found this little treasure.  Great chef, great food, went there for brunch.  Perfect with tons of free parking.  Will be back.

We're from California and if this place was in California not only would I visit often, but the wait would probably be two hours. Very friendly staff. Chef comes out to check in everyone. Great menu with superb variety sure to please anyone. We went on a Sunday morning around 930am and there was no wait. The food - delicious! I had the egg benedict, it was very tasty with very thick bacon. I couldn't eat all the bacon. Hubby and son had the breakfast burrito and cinnamon roll. They said the burrito was very good and could see why this place gets 5 stars. The cinnamon roll is very sweeet with frosting, whipped cream and strawberries on top. If I'm in Vegas again, I would come back...otherwise, Zenaida's, feel free to come to California!

Three of us had breakfast here this morning because of the rave reviews on Yelp and several other sites. It was a good choice.
Eggs and sausages perfectly done. Diced potatoes seasoned and served hot. They were so good. One of our diners ordered the avocado toast for us to share and it really was  an unusual, and interesting dish. We loved it. No complaints here.
The owner/chef Sterling, came over to our table and spoke with us. A very friendly man who seems to love his job. The tall toke said he knew what he was doing. Sterling's daughter Carmen, was hostess and server. Not only cute as a button but a sweet bubbly personality.. and very efficient.
The furnishings and decor are no frills simple, but the place is very clean. We came for the food and we left satisfied and knowing we would be back again.

I decided to take my mom out for brunch mid afternoon and was unsure of where to go. Somehow we never been here before (we live less than a mile away) and I'm sad we never have because this place is so good. The food was amazing. We got the breakfast burrito and the biscuits and gravy. As you wait they bring these chips that are the perfect consistency. The staff was friendly and we never felt more taken care of. Super happy to find a new place!!

The food, the chef and the rest of the staff are great. We were in Henderson at an expensive resort for a high school reunion and wanted to go someplace else for breakfast. We found Zenaida's on Yelp and 9 of us went there to try it out. I won't go in to all the dishes, because everyone ordered something different, but suffice it to say that they were all great and plentiful. We liked it so much we went back the next day again and brought another 7 classmates with us for a total of 16 of us. Everyone enjoyed their food. The chef came out and talked to us afterwards bringing hot, homemade chocolate chip cookies with amazing whipped cream of all of us on the house. Their special menu those two days was amazing with a variety of Eggs Benedict and omelets. The biscuit and gravy with sausage would have fed several. All of us would go back if given the chance to be back in that area.

You know when you're afraid to try new places because it may not be as good as you thought it would be? Zenaida's is the complete opposite. It's the kind of place that makes you want to kick yourself for not going there sooner. 

The location and signage makes it a little hard to see and find. I first saw it when we went to Taco y Taco. We decided to stop by today for breakfast and the restaurant was decently busy. Jazz music was playing in the background. We ordered the avocado toast to start, my boyfriend had the biscuits and gravy and I had the tofu scrambled. Along with our avocado toast the waitress brought out a basket of chips with aioli. The chips seemed homemade, they were thin, salty, and as long as a full potato. 

This was my first experience having avocado toast and it was unreal. The garlic of the toast blended perfectly with the creamy avocado and the tomatoes were juicy. It was a perfect starter and I officially know what the hype is with avocado toast.  

Now my boyfriend gets biscuits and gravy pretty much everywhere that offers it. This biscuits and gravy blew his mind. He is convinced it's the best he's ever had. The gravy wasn't white and coagulated, it was full of sausage chunks. The biscuits were dense and split in two so there was a great balance of gravy to biscuits. To top it off they add hot links! This reminds me of how every breakfast in Alaska comes with reindeer sausage. I could have just eaten the hot links as a breakfast. 

By the time I got to my tofu scramble I was pretty full already. The scramble was presented on a long plate in a log formation, similar to how fried rice is served. It was full of huge chunks of broccoli, cauliflower, rice, and mushrooms. If you don't really like tofu, go ahead and get this scramble because it's very well hidden and it's basically like a breakfast vegetable fried rice. My favorite part was the furikake and nori tucked inside. 

The meal ended with a warm chocolate chip cookie for both of us. My boyfriend was seriously smiling the entire time we were there. We can't wait to come back and try everything from the zucchini fries to the monte cristo to the chicken wings. Best hidden gem in the neighborhood!

We're in town temporarily, decided to give this place a try and was not disappointed.  The decor was nice, even though small it was cozy. Servers were very nice & very efficient. The menu had a pretty good variety of dishes to choose from that it made it difficult to decide, but in a good way! We decided on shrimp & grits, a burger & fries and crispy chicken wings & fries. They were all really good choices & the pumpkin bread pudding that was offered for dessert was awesome! Loved it!  We'll definitely be back!!

This is one of the best resturants I have been to in a very long time. Not only was the food incredible with a three coarse breakfast but, the enviorment was spectacular. It was a comfortable setting with light music playing in the back. After our amazing meal, mine being a perfectly cooked hamburger seasoned just as well, the chef himself came out to talk with us! The portions are amazing as well. My parents had gotten cheese grits with THE BEST sausage I have ever tried, then their second meal came out. Corn beef and hash and tri tip! And my only response was WOW!!!! The meat was increditably fresh and seasoned so so well! Not to mention the fantastic desert to finish off the meal. I definetly will be returning to try more of their amazing food

This place was a bit difficult to find since it's tucked inside a generic-looking shopping center, but totally worth it! Yelpers did not steer us wrong since this place deserves 5+ stars! The food was amazing - we tried the oatmeal, bagel with lox, and the lite breakfast. All delicious! The piece de resistance was when the chef came out and asked how things were going, and then a few minutes later came out with the most moist and delicious cookies with freshly made whipped cream. Delightful! Chef Sterling Burbee is a highly experience & trained chef, as you'll see along the wall of fame wall in the restaurant, and you can tell he really cares about his restaurant (which we assume he downgraded to have a more mellow life after commanding huge kitchen operations in another life). We wish Chef Sterling the best and can't wait to visit again when we're in Vegas!

Enter to see empty tables, but told there is a wait... okay... 
Finally seated, I ask for coffee and water. Person I am with asks for water. We get one water and one coffee.... hmmmm.... 
Wait and wait and wait for order to be taken... four employees wandering around.... unorganized.
Finally order... waiter was dismissive and cold.... opinion plummeting....
Received our order of cinnamon roll and a biscuit and gravy add eggs.... looked pretty.
Flavor of gravy... fair... hamburger gravy... biscuits were fair.... the hot links added a bit of seasoning to otherwise flat flavored plate...
Finished biscuit and gravy.... go to take a bite of cinnamon roll... cannot cut through with fork.... bad sign.... take knife to it.... still have to pull it apart rather than cut it.... supposedly fresh made... when? Two days ago???!!!! Employee says today... yeah right!
Friend is now totally angry.... we've had poor service, watched other get poor service, watched another pair walk out from lack of service.... another pair waiting for an eternity for bill and to go box!
That did it! Friend got waiter, complained, waiter looked stunned!  I wonder if they have any idea of the impression they make....
They went from minimally apologetic to non apologetic and we walked out.... done.
We won't be back.

This place was amazing! Lots of vegan and vegetarian options for my husband and lots of bacon and sausage for me. Most important to me is the small patio area for my dogs. Chef Sterling came outside to greet us to see if we enjoyed our meal. We told him it was the best meal we've had in a long time. He even came back out with tri-tip steak for our 2 pit bulls. It was so nice of him! 
We had the vegetarian sandwich, the Sterling breakfast with eggs and bacon and tremaines biscuits and gravy!

Can't wait to go back! I wish they were open for dinner!

Cute little restaurant that is family owned. The food was super delicious, zero complaints about it. The only issue we had about the service is that it was a bit slow since there was only one waiter working on the day we went. I'm not sure if that's the norm for them. Either way it wasn't enough for me to take a star away since he was super friendly when we needed him at our table.
Very cool little cafe. Clean restaurant. Very good food and service ! We will be going back.

I am honestly surprised that this establishment has a five star rating on Yelp. The service was really slow even when there was hardly anyone in the restaurant, and the waiter gave us some attitude. I am just glad that the food I got, a breakfast burrito, was really good. However , the food that my friends ordered was subpar. The coffee is also so weak that it tastes like water. It's supposedly dark roast Colombian! I think the quality of the coffee really determines how good a restaurant is.

Amazing place just outside the strip. Food is FANTASTIC, service is personable and Prices are perfect!! Parking is great. Chef/owner brought us out a beautiful dessert sampler as a thank you. Will be back from sure!!!

Gave this spot a try due to all the stellar reviews.
I ordered up all of the favorites on the menu.

To start we got the cinnamon roll, which was hot and goey! It really had a different taste and texture then your standard run of the meal cinabun type concoction. Super yummy.

Next was the garlic fries. They give you a massive portion of these spuds! Nice and crisp and packed with flavor.

After that was the chicken and waffles, chicken tasted fresh and crisp with a certain coconut hint of flavor. Interesting indeed. Waffle was a nice crispy base for the Carmel drizzle.

Finally was the benny with the home fries.. pretty standard holendaise and was not that eventful.

The service seemed a bit overwhelmed after the morning brunch crowd rolled in. Plus the chief sends out free goodies to tables. We didn't get one but we had already ordered 4 items so we was stuffed.

Wish I could give 3.5 stars here.

We stopped in on our last day of our little Vegas getaway. Located in an unassuming little strip mall, I would have easily overlooked this place had it not been for Yelp.
I can't even begin to write about how good this place is! Everything was fantastic, the coffee, the eggs Benedict, the fantastic homemade chips with their addictive sauce. And the bacon. Thick cut and perfectly cooked. Even my super critical husband couldn't find a bad thing to say.
The service was friendly and kind. After our meal, while we were in a daze of happiness, our server dropped off a plate of cookies.  
I usually mock the reviewers in my head when they write that they don't want to share how good a place is because it'll get too popular and they won't be able to get a table so easy anymore.  But here I am, hesitating to submit this little review.

Zenaida's is so good!  Go there as soon as it's daylight out and pat your belly from sweet sweet satisfaction afterwards.

I really liked this place. The food was great as well as the service. The Chef and Owner came over to see how we were doing and how the service was. I ordered the BLT, I'm a bacon lover so this was heaven for me. The bacon was a slate bacon which was thick and very tasty. The flavors all came together tastefully. The portions are generous. I can't wait to go back an try the Quinoa burger that was recommended. The place was nice, clean and intimate.

What a great breakfast.  Dixon found this place on Yelp!   Amazing, kind service.   Great food.   Special treats: a portion to share of lovely hand-made potato chips, then fresh chocolate chip cookies smothered in chantilly cream and strawberries!   Super sweet. Next time we're here we will be back.  This is an ideal spot to stop on your way back to the airport!

Seriously had no idea what we were walking in to. Thank goodness for Yelp. These 5 star reviews are legit. 

We ordered burgers and wings and our meals could not have been better at the most expensive fine dining place on the strip. 

Service was superb too. We got complimentary hummus appetizers and bananas fosters for dessert. Can't say enough about this place. It was absolutely awesome.
The best food ever!!!! I cannot remember the last time FOOD hit all my Senses like this. Love it! The chef served us a complimentary pumpkin spruce bread pudding which was PHENOMENAL!!!!
Great breakfast and perfect  cooked eggs.  Chef personally came to talk to us.  It is a really hidden gem in Vegas.  Recommended.

Wow!  This place is a hidden gym!! So delicious!!! Everything we ordered was amazing!! The service was awesome everyone was very friendly.  Hands down to the chef!! I wanted my eggs super runny and he made it perfectly how i wanted it.  My hunnies eggs Benedict was perfected poached! I highly recommend the avocado toast! My goodness that was a great starter!!

This is a follow up review to my earlier post, and all I can say is they just keep getting better and better. I'm on their mailing list and each week they send out that week's "Additions" which are basically the specials for the week (Wednesday through Sunday).  My taste buds and I are always amazed at the new offerings each week, and more often than not that's what I get.  

This week's additions included a pork loin stack that was incredible. It had blackened pork loin medallions on top of a potato and onion hash and topped with eggs over easy and a tomato-spiked Hollandaise sauce. They finished the meal with a complimentary warm cookie topped fresh whipped cream. 

This is an excellent spot to meet your friends and family for weekend brunch. If you get there before the rest of your party you can enjoy a cup of coffee in their lounge area while checking out the small photo gallery. They serve a Primo Columbian coffee and the servers always keep your cup full. 

They are very adept at handling large groups as well. I arrived one morning just after a party of 14 had been seated, and despite my fears that I was in for a long wait for my meal, I was served just as promptly as always. If you have a large group they will take reservations. 

If you have a sweet tooth be sure to try the cinnamon rolls. Be warned, however, they are huge so you'll probably want to share. The breakfast burger and the eggs Benedict are also excellent choices. The chef makes each order of Hollandaise sauce when you order your meal, so if there is something on the additions menu that includes Hollandaise sauce, go for it!

great food.  great srvice.  the chef, Sterlong was amazing.  actaully came out and checked on every single guest.  nobody does that anymore.  that is some next level ser ice right there!  i got a smoked salmon omlet.  cooked perfectly!  they had capers!!  awesome!  capers may or may not be your thing, but just the fact that they had them is amazing.

I've been meaning to come here for a while now. It's rare to find cute, locally owned and operated joints on the east-side that aren't tacos or sushi. Hehe. 

I just had the best macaroni and cheese ever. It was creamy, truffley, and so warm and delicious! 

The zucchini fries were fresh and a fun way to start lunch. 

Service was really great! The server was friendly and and the food came out faster than expected for made-to-order. 


The chef gave us cookies at the end!!! As a gif.

Wow is all I can say. I finally was able to check this place out, something I've been meaning to do ever since my coworker recommended it to me.

From the outside it looks fairly unassuming, but don't let that fool you. This place is legit. 

I wish I had taken more pictures; I absolutely love the decor. It's very homey, and the rainbow checkered floor makes me so happy. There's also jazz music playing in the background. You feel quite relaxed here.

We were greeted as soon as we walked in, and seated promptly. The service was amazing, as the staff frequently checked in with us. The chef also walked around the room and chatted with customers. I love that personal touch.

I ordered the Trio Salad, which was essentially three types of salad - egg salad, tuna salad, and lobster salad. It normally comes with grapes, but they were out and the chef personally came to ask me if I would like watermelon and strawberries. I said yes, and was very pleased as they were extremely juicy and sweet.

Before we got our check, we received chocolate chip cookies with caramel drizzle, compliments of the chef. That was a very nice touch and greatly appreciated. 

From looking at their menu, it looks like it's also a great spot for breakfast and brunch. I will definitely be back!

Super cute place off the strip great coffee and amazing food! The chef opened the Winn and he knows how to make your belly happy! We will definitely be back! Very sweet girl was our server and another nice server helped out, not overly crowded on a Saturday morning, a lot of food options. Prices are around 10-12 per person for a huge amount of quality food!

This place is a hidden gem! My bf lives by here, and one day we passed by this place and read their menu that's posted by the door and we told ourselves we have to try it one day. Well today was that day, we left this with our bellies full of satisfaction and smiles on our faces.
