Our server was very nice, even stopping to let us know their specials and how they have dinners on Friday nights. The chef and owner, Sterling, came out to greet us and chat about his cooking style and the restaurant. He's a really awesome guy and his food taste amazing. We got the avocado toast, tofu scramble, waffles, breakfast potatoes, and scrambled eggs. Chef Sterling also gave us free Apple cobbler, which my bf and I couldn't stop eating. If you're in the area, or even just wanting to try a new place with great flavors come try out Zenaidas. My bf and I will definetly be back!

A hidden gem outside the strip! So good we actually came back the next morning :)

We had the avocado toast, eggs benedict, omelet, & breakfast burrito & all were really great! The chef was very kind & came out to ask everyone how the food was. I thought that was nice. 

The avocado toast is a must try!
Dropped in for lunch, had the Eggplant stacks and Panko Crusted Zucchini Fries. The food and service was excellent.
The food was amazing! Service was outstanding! Every time we come to town, we'll be making a stop her.

All I can say... If there wasn't over a 2,000 mile impedament, I would eat here every day. Amazingly delicious! Friendly and incredibly attentive wait staff. Nice trendy atmosphere. Love the jazz music.  We had the eggs Benedict and southwestern omelet both were out of this world! This place you don't want to miss!! Very reasonably priced too

This place is ahhhmazing. Its a quaint little place with all the gourmet flavors you could ever want. When you first arrive you are greeted immediately...we had a party of 7 i was surprised they got us seated within 5 min. Once we got to our table they took our drink orders... Shortly thereafter they took our food orders ,..while we waited for our food to arrive they brought us free homemade potato chips with a homemade aioli sauce... The sauce was so good my 2 year old grandson tore it up and he can be a picky eater. They also gave us a complimentary avocado toast because another party ordered it inadvertently. It was delicious.. Avocado was fresh..ripe cherry tomatoes ..only wish we had a little more of that balsamic vinegar they splashed on top... My shrimp and grits arrived. Omgoodness it was scrumptious.. And there was plenty of grits i had enough to bring home for dinner. My party also ordered the clam chowder if you like meaty hearty clams this is definitely the meal to get... Everyone in our party was pleasantly happy with their order. As a grand finale they served each of us a pumpkin bread pudding with a side of whipped topping... It was definitely a delightful ending to our meal. My boyfriend doesnt like pumpkin and even he ate the entire dessert. The chef personally approached us to thank us for coming. Customer service was top notch. I gave this place 5 stars ...the only thing i think they could work on is making sure all the food comes to the table at the same time. My daughter waited about 10 mins after we were served for her chicken wings to arrive.other than that they are top notch.. My family and i will definitely be coming back!!

Wow wow wow!!! Definitely more than a 5 star restaurant. As soon as you walk in you are welcomed with a smile and feel the positive vibe in here. Food was more than great! You can definitely taste that it's made from scratch and not canned. What amazed me the most is that the Cheff himself came out to greet us, ask us how the food was and made conversation with us. Our waiter was also friendly and gave us the best undivided attention ever. We never had to ask for a water refill, he automatically provided service. Were from San Bernardino and Orange County, wish they were here! Thank you for a great meal and outstanding service!

A friend of mine brought me here last week. Lots of great choices on the menu. Food was delicious and plentiful. I highly recommend the avocado toast! Very quaint cafe. The Chef came to our table and asked if we enjoyed our meals. He even gave us a complimentary dessert which was absolutely delicious! The staff were friendly and very efficient. I cannot wait to bring my family here!

I've been trying to come here for a while since I've heard lots of good things about this place, but it's kind of hard with it closing at 2 pm. The food here is good and the service was excellent. The servers were very attentive and the Chef even gave us a complimentary dessert. It was a pumpkin bread dessert that we ate up real fast. We ordered the Shrimp and Grits, thick cut bacon, and the Monte Cristo

Shrimp and Grits: This dish was good. The grits weren't overcooked or over seasoned and had a lot of cheese in them. There was also a good amount of shrimp on the plate and came with over easy eggs.  This dish had way too much sauce on the plate, which kind of took over the buttery and cheesy flavor of the grits. Less sauce and this would be almost perfect. 

Monte Cristo: This was a really good breakfast sandwich. The eggs were nice and runny and the bread was not soggy. The potatoes were nice and soft on the inside and crispy on the outside.

Bacon: I wish I would've ordered more of this. Nothing better than extra thick cut bacon.

My guy took me here for brunch yesterday and we really enjoyed our food!  Tastefully decorated  & comfortable booths.  We had a cheeseburger deluxe & it was a huge burger. We especially liked the dessert homemade chocolate cup cookies topped with fresh made whipped cram everyone was so friendly and made us feel right at home!

Sorry I could only give 5 stars this place is really fantastic.  I had the sirloin hash with ailoi sauce and Bleu cheese topped with 2 eggs, the dish was creative and delicious.  My wife had the eggs Benedict and they were heavenly.  Service was awesome.  Chef comes out and greets each table and thanks his guests for coming to his restaurant.  You can't go wrong with this choice.

THIS IS THE PLACE!!!

Brought wife here on Sunday morning just after they opened and she had a bit of time trying to find it from the outside.  It is in a shopping center on Trop & Pecos but with minimal and  I mean very little advertising so you know it has to be good if mostly only locals talk about it.

A very small place on the inside with about seats for 40-50 people compared to your major breakfast places that try to herd em in like cattle.  I got the tofu scramble as I am vegetarian and wife got the chicken & waffles with a side of eggs which are about as good as you will anywhere else.  And when I got up to pay,  our server told us to hang out a bit as there was something special coming which was the previously mentioned apple cobbler sampler as a dessert.  Excellent surprise.  What truly truly makes this place special is the attention to detail including what is on the menu and what they are out of or alternative choices.  Service is higher than top notch and if you time it so they are not too busy,  You will enjoy it every time,

One of the top 10 Hidden Gems not only in Vegas but all of Nevada!!

Wow this place was like no other breakfast place I have ever been too! The quality of food is at 5 star!! I ordered the tremaine biscuit and gravy, it was beyond good. My girlfriend ordered the sausage monte Christo and that as well we delicious. The service was great and they were really nice! I can't wait to come back and try something different!!

Really nice place with a homey feel. Great food. I don't go out for breakfast very much so I prefer elaborative and "hip" places,  so the simplicity of the menu turned me off. Oh boy, was I wrong. Do yourself a favor, visit and have Z's Monte Christo.

When we walked in, we was automatically greet by the staff. They are very nice and welcoming. The inferior was simple and they even had a jukebox. I don't know if it was working. The food is delicious and fresh. 

For starters we ordered avocado toast to shared. This is my first time having legit avocado toast and I am happy I had it here. It comes in 5 pieces and there is a small salad on top of the toast. The avocado toast was delicious! The toast, avocado, tomatoes and onion all perfectly blended together to make this one dish.

My sister order the waffle and turkey sausage. The waffle had whip creme and strawberries. It was a yummy and fluffy waffle. The whip cream and strawberries made it even better, I did not even need to use syrup. The turkey sausage cake in 4 pieces. They were a good size and was pretty thick. 

I ordered the chicken breast sandwich. The sandwich was big and it came with fries. It was a pesto chicken sandwich with tomatoes. The chicken pieces were huge which I liked. I was only able to finish half of it. 

They also gave us a complimentary dessert! It was 2 fresh baked cookies. It was soft and it put a smile on my face after the first bite. I love cookies and especially since it was fresh it made me even happier. I would pay for this cookie, so I can take it home to eat. It was a surprising and perfect dessert to end the meal. We will definitely be back.

One of my favorite lunch spots. The have great vegan/ vegetarian options. Staff is wonderful. Chef asks guests occasionally if food was as expected and has even sent complimentary sides for me to enjoy my meal. They're open Wednesday through Sunday. I look forward to lunch every time I visit this cafe.
I just had a light lunch and it was fabulous. We tried the clam chowder in a bread bowl, the avocado toast and the smoked salmon plate. Delicious! We will be back!
just had lunch there, and wow! it was really good. They have vegan options!.. everything was delicious and service was great.

We had a chance to wait for a few minutes before a table was ready. It gave my wife and I a chance to enjoy the cool photos they have for sale. They also have jazz playing. Not "let's-play-a-Michael-Jackson-song-and-add-a-saxophone-to-it" smooth jazz, no this is straight ahead jazz. I enjoy that on a lazy Sunday.

We received an order of fresh potato chips and sauce. Compliments of the chef.

My wife had the biscuits and gravy. The hot links were just spicy enough. Interesting that they use a brown gravy instead of the usual. 
I ordered the eggs Benedict. After I ordered, the staff informed me that they had run out of the slab bacon, so I had to settle for the regular ham. It was okay. The hollandaise had a bit more lemon than I usually like but it was not off-putting. I was a little upset. If I have my taste buds ready for something, I do not appreciate substitutions well. I'm whiney? Sure! Do I pay for my food? Yes! So, I guess I can act like a disappointed middle schooler if I want. Usually, after careful thought and reflection, I can appreciate what I had, but in this case, I really was intrigued by this "slab bacon" and was quite disappointed by getting something less. I get it. It's popular. I can understand limit of product. I thought we were there early enough. Maybe because it was the day after the time change...who knows. It certainly did not take away from the quality of the meal nor the staff. Both were impeccable.

After our meal, the chef sent out moist chocolate chip cookies with yummy cream sauce. Very good.

So, the verdict was, we liked it well enough to try it again and I would definitely recommend giving this place a try. I'm sure you will dig it.

Been here a couple times. This is my first review maybe second ... anywhere ... on anything ... just don't do it. For me to do it now says a lot. Try Zenaida's you won't be sorry. Breakfast or Lunch it's very good.

I just had a wonderful time at Zenaida's Cafe!  From the warm greeting, to the complimentary homemade chips & aioli, to the delicious Mother's Day brunch my family and I had, I would highly recommend this place!!!  The chef and staff go out of their way to make this a memorable experience!  From avocado toast, to eggs Benedict, to Asian chicken salad and a pork chop Stack, I am sure everything on the menu is just as delicious as what we had!  My son had the brunch special with lobster bisque, (with Huge chunks of lobster) smoked salmon Benedict and a yummy dessert!  Excellent!  Then to complete the meal, the chef sent out a some warm, gooey, homemade chocolate chip cookies, drizzled in Caramel sauce, also complementary!  Thank you to Zenaida's for making it a fabulous Mother's Day!  We will definitely go back!!!

My friends and I know why this place gets 5 stars! I'm in Vegas for the weekend and needed to eat something real quick. I wasn't even hungry but as soon as my food came out, I started eating without even breathing. This Asian salad is so delicious and the portion is so big too! Of course, reasonable price!! The service was the best; the chef himself came out to check on customers and the whole staff constantly checked on us to make sure everything is fine. 
AND they even gave us complimentary warm chocolate chip cookies! The best place to get brunch in Vegas!
I don't think I'll be going here again. The atmosphere was cool but the food was not good at all.

I was in Las Vegas for the AKA Leadership Conference.  My girlfriend highly recommended this restaurant. A group of us decided to go, and it was the best food we had while in Vegas. The meal was reasonably priced, actually I expected it to be more. We had so much food we had take out boxes. St the end if the meal the Chef surprised us with Ambrosia  If you go to this restaurant, you will not be disappointed. The chef and staff were so attentive to us.  We asked if they would take a picture with us and they did.

Very good food and very clean. You must come and try it out. The chef sure knows his stuff. I really liked the fact the  he actually took the time to go around every table and asked if everything was ok. 
I definitely will be back!!  great customer service!!

OMG!!! This was so yummy and so much food it was amazing and the cookies we got after with the whip Cream salted carmel sauce and the strawberry was the best dessert I have had ...And I have been to alot of very expensive restaurants this could be on any of there menues. But it's in this little amazing place. I am so glad we found this place many many miles away from our home but we'll worth it.

Oh my goodness. Let me just say this is probably the best breakfast place I've ever been to. I've always felt like home cooked meals are best because you can taste the love someone puts into their food and I can honestly say it tasted like a home cooked meal. I'm big on breakfast but my mom was in town and she's huge on "yelping" lol. We were not disappointed. I had the waffle with bacon. Do not skip the whip. The bacon was a thick cut slice and that was really good too lol. Everything was exceptional; the clam chowder, the chicken and waffles, chicken and fries EVERYTHING.

Amazing food! The chef comes out to greet you. We received complementary deserts to try. 
Love the mom and pop feel and the food top of the line. 
Eggs Bennie. 
Corn beef hash. 
The homemade potato chips. 
Customer service, clean. 
This will be the new spot. 
You won't be disappointed!
Excited to come back for supper!

I couldnt ask for a better way to set off on the road after our family trip. Found this gem on Yelp and I will be stopping off next time I am in town. The services was kind and helpful. The chefs house fries were amazing with the aioli sauce. My husbands omelet had him trying to finish even thought he was full. Tots wete fried to perfection, very crispy but far from dry. The chocolate chip cookies with caramel drizzle is magical!! I saved a few for the road.
Super nice people, very attentive, chef interaction! Great food, especially the Mac N Cheese!!! Really good comfort food. Wonderful wonderful people and food, will definitely come back.

Today was my second time there and it didn't disappoint. I think I need to go a zillion more times so I can try everything and the specials. Today I had the chicken and waffle. Generous serving and so good you eat the whole thing because you don't want to stop eating. The chicken has an amazing flavor and cooked perfectly. The waffle was nice and fluffy and soaked up the syrup beautifully. My friend got the eggs Benedict and she was super happy. We also got a n order of fried zucchini to share and we gobbled them right up. You can tell everything is cooked from scratch with fresh ingredients. Even though I am in a food coma, can't wait for my next visit. Also, the chef sent out some homemade chips with a garlic aioli good enough to bathe in and at the end of the meal warm chocolate chip cookies! You can tell everything is cooked with love and you can feel it while there. Food nirvana!

La atencion y la comida exelente todo esta en su punto, el servicio fue rapido y muy cordial la musica muy relajante perfecta para platicar y pasar un buen tiempo con la familia o los amigos... Definitivamente sera un lugar oficial para visitar cada vez que benga de vacaciones a la Vegas. 

Such a hidden gem, the attention and detail placed on the food and clients is magnificent.

Amazing cafe! Original menu items, with vegan and meat sections! I had the eggplant stacks, which were amazing and my husband had the tofu scramble. That was delicious too. The service is attentive and the chef sent out some warm chocolate chip cookies after our meal. Definitely will be back.

I regret ever checking in here on Facebook and I absolutely regret adding to the 180 - 5 Star reviews that are 100% justified. Selfishly, I don't want anyone else to know about how amazing this restaurant is because I want to be able to get a table. Amazing everything. The passion for the craft is here.
Great food. Reasonably priced. Good atmosphere.   Jazz was good but a bit loud. Would recommend!

My husband was looking for a nice place for breakfast on a Sunday morning, and was wanting something different. He found it!

We were greeted as soon as we walked through the door. After looking at a few photos on yelp, we thought that there was a regular menu of items to choose from. We like to split a meal, and maybe get a side of something as well. We soon realized that we were given a Brunch Menu. (update 1/11/17 ***I have been informed by another Yelper that they are no longer serving Brunch) This is not what we had been anticipating, but the price was so amazing at $13.95/ person. And on the menu was Eggs Benedict, so I was sold. 

There were 3 courses for the brunch. I chose the Yogurt Parfait, Eggs Benedict and an Apple Cobbler. My husband chose a traditional Fresh Smoked Salmon Platter, Eggs Benedict and Cheesecake (this one was to go).

We each got a coffee and water. Our waitress brought a plate of large cut lemons for our waters, and brought us fresh brewed coffees. They do not bring around a pot to refill the coffees, but rather bring a fresh mug. The coffee was strong, but good. 

My yogurt parfait had blueberries and raspberries along with a half of a strawberry as garnish. The yogurt, granola and fruit were all wonderful. I could have eaten another, but this one was huge! It was just so good. The smoked salmon platter had red onion, capers, egg, tomatoes, Dijon and salmon of course. It came with soda crackers, or what reminded me of them. We were also given freshly made potato chips that were seasoned wonderfully. They were thin and crisp, and were paired with a tasty aioli. 

Chef Sterling came out to our table and talked with us a bit. He asked if we were enjoying our meal so far. It was great to learn that he had been the executive chef at the Wynn, and that he had recently opened this awesome restaurant. He asked if he could go ahead and start our Eggs Benedict, and then proceeded to prepare them. After they were brought to our table, he came out to let us know that he uses hand carved, slab cut bacon in his benedict. OH MY GOSH!!! I ALWAYS get bacon instead of Canadian bacon, but hand carved...slab...cut..Wow. I didn't even know this existed. I took a photo of our bacon from the side. You need to look at it, it is so thick. Yum! He makes his hollandaise sauce for each order as well. It was light and flavorful. His potatoes were tender and very slightly crispy as if they were flash fried. The seasoning was perfect. We could not eat all of our breakfast, so we asked for to-go boxes. But then we had an apple cobbler because, why not?! 

AMAZING. It truly was. The apples were sweet and wonderful, nice and hot with a side of vanilla ice cream. I did not ask if the ice cream was homemade, but it sure tasted like it could have been. I would not doubt it. It was creamy, and perfect with the hot cobbler. 

Chef Sterling's attention to detail is impeccable. This was the best dining experience that we have had in a very long time, and it was just supposed to be a simple breakfast. What a treat. We are definitely coming back to try out more of Chef's goodies. You must come here. You will not be disappointed. He does not advertise, and mentioned Yelp! He asked if we had heard of it (umm...maybe! :D ) So come on Yelpers, check this place out! We wish Chef Sterling all of the best.

I got the breakfast burrito which was good. It came with a side of fried potatoes. They stuffed the burrito full of eggs, I couldn't even finish the other half. My wife got the stuffed French toast and it was amazing!!!i highly recommend it. The only problem with this place is there is no kids menu so be ready to pay more for your little ones. The chef was awesome, he came out a couple times and gave us free chips and dip at the beginning of our meal and free banana pudding for desert. I will be coming back when in Vegas, cool place, good food, and great chef.
This place is AMAZING great atmosphere, delicious food, best service. Soothing music in the back ground. I can not stress enough how good the food was!
Awesome service, great portions, well-cooked, flavorful food. Super stoked we gave this little place a chance.

The perfect place!!! The service is impeccable and so is the food.  And the
Chef came out and gave out free stuff.
I had the smoked salmon plate and it was perfectly presented and delicious!  
Reasonably priced and great choice for breakfast or lunch.  
The homemade chips were yummy and the bite of bread pudding was very good.

Id been wanting to try this place for a while and it was great. pretty presentation. great service. 
can't wait to go back.

This place is very unpretentious and solid. The service is friendly, and even the chef comes out to check on you. We went on a Sunday morning and it wasn't too packed. 

The cinnamon roll, as everyone says is exceedingly delicious- though it is very sweet with that caramel sauce, so be prepared. The Benedict and breakfast burrito got great reviews from my friends, and my standard eggs and potatoes just what I wanted. The breakfast potatoes are the little squares, which is what I prefer, and they are great with the special aioli. 

Overall, great value and pleasant experience!

Amazing blend of flavors in an unassuming location. 

My wife and I had the Avocado toast and the Shrimp and grits. The toast was a little oily but the fresh avocado and tomatoes tasted amazing. The grits had some of the largest shrimp I've had in a breakfast dish.

Highly recommend
Amazing! A Vegas hidden gem! Delicious food and excellent chef. Always wonderful meeting the chef  amazing food and even better service. Very accommodating.
Delicious food, clean and inviting atmosphere, and delightfully friendly staff. Breakfast burrito is a winner.
Love this place come here often it's more of a family environment the people are nice & the food is good

What a great place! Huge portions, extremely friendly staff and the quality of food that you would expect a much more expensive restaurant. Do yourself a big favor and get the avocado toast. Highly recommended!

Casual and inexpensive. I had tomato bisque for a light lunch. $4.95 (I think). The chef sent out a cup of his chicken noodle soup also because he was proud of it. Both were delicious. The only thing wrong was the place is empty. Cmon....come over here. Trop and Pecos near Taco y Taco and the Eagle.

The food is really good! I order an egg whites omelette that had cheese, spinach, turkey sausage & a side of breakfast potatoes. The food was very filling & generous portions. The chef personally came to the table & thanked me for coming that was definitely what helped me give a 5 star rating. I am visiting from out of town and that small gesture will make this place memorable for me. If I ever find myself back in Vegas I will return.

Zenaida where have you been all of my life?? Well, all of my 13 yrs & 5 mos in LV.

It seems that I'm on a never-ending quest to find that quaint little local breakfast/brunch place that is simultaneously no frills and spectacular. Also, said place must not be overrun. A hidden gem, if you will.

There are a million breakfast and brunch options in this town and most of them are doing a fine job. Few are going above and beyond. Zenaida's is one of the few.

I don't go out for breakfast all that often, despite most of my bookmarks being for breakfast places. I love breakfast. I'm just not too keen on the that side of noon. So, when I am going out to breakfast it becomes a big decision as to where to go. I had had Zenaida's bookmarked for a while, and only put it on my to try list because it was close by with 5 stars on Yelp. 

When we arrived we received a warm greeting. We were instructed to sit anywhere we liked. Within a few minutes the server took our drink order and while she was gone to get them, a 2nd server stopped to make sure she had been over and drinks were on the way. It made me feel like they had a lot of team mentality to ensure the customer was always taken care of.

We weren't super hungry so we decided to share a cinnamon roll & the chicken in waffles. After we ordered they brought is house made chips with a bloody Mary aoli. Honestly, I can't think of any other breakfast places with give you something like this at breakfast. Plus, it was really delicious. I don't even like aoli, but I was all over this. The chips we're fantastic.

 My husband is a bit of a cinnamon roll connesieur, and this one did not disappoint! Not only was this cinnamon roll fresh and delicious, but it had a beautiful presentation that I just wasn't expecting from a little whole in the wall breakfast place. Every time I go to Zenaida's, this will be a must. Fresh baked & served warm.

The chicken & waffles, which aren't normally my thing, we're also great. I like my chicken crispy and this was crispy with a hint of sweetness. The waffle tasted great, but I would have preferred that to be crispy as well, and it was more on the cakey side.

As a special treat, we were given warm gooey chocolate chip cookies from the chef at no charge. A completely unexpected, but extremely appreciated surprise. They were amazing.

While we ate, I was listening to the next table over talking about Zenaida's food. It appeared to be a family of 1/2 locals and 1/2 visiting from parts unknown. The locals were raving about the food and said their Mac n Cheese "the most decadent thing you'll ever eat".

I don't know why I dragged my feet checking this place out, but I've been fantasizing about that cinnamon roll, and I can't wait to go back.

Zenaida's is clean, the food is great, and the service is outstanding.

Went for lunch and it was delicious. Shared the nacho fries and they were fantastic - highlight of the whole meal. Also had a Cobb salad - there was lots of yummy bacon and avocado. I was sad that no one else was there (it was 1 on a friday). Get out there and support our local businesses! They have a small, but very interesting menu with lots of fresh ingredients. I will go back if they stay open.

This place was amazing. Before coming into the restaurant there's a cute fountain with two tables outside, perfect for nice weather. Once we walked in our host/server welcomed us in. She was very nice and welcoming. As we were being seated the chef said hello as well, which mind you doesn't really happen. They have their regular menu + a today's special menu. We ordered the tri tip on a baguette, nacho style fries, quinoa vegan burger, and cookies and cream for dessert. The tri tip sandwich and quinoa burger was amazing. Even the salad you can tell all the veggies and ingredients were carefully picked out. There were no bruises on any of the greens, I was so surprised! The chef came up to us and made sure we were enjoying the food. 

Hands down a place you should check out and see for yourself how awesome this place is.

I loved loved this place. I am a vegan and we just dropped by last minute. The chef went out of his way to create vegan options. His family has vegan and vegetarian members. The most delicious vegan squash soup, tofu scramble, and quinoa burger.

First time in the Zenaidas and let me tell you it was hands down the best service I've had. We were greeted by the waitress and chef. Both checked on our group after we tried the food to make sure everything was up to our liking. All our plates were cleared once we finished. Refills were offered in a timely manner. The chef gave us a complementary dessert which was probably the best thing I've ever tasted. This is my new breakfast spot. Lanore was the sweetest and very attentive. Thank you for the awesome experience! You guys are awesome!

This is my favorite breakfast place,food is amazing and service excellent. I would recommend this place to anyone 
The chef is a great cook! Just love it no other place like this.
Fair prices and amazing food.  I had the grilled asparagus and bourchin open faced omelette and also had a oatmeal caramel cream cookie compliments of the chef.  Great service as well.

So I have to say food is 5 stars. We arrived and waited, no problem. When we were seated she asked what we wanted to drink. Water, easy. 15 min later no water, no waitress. She passed by and hubby told her we were ready. She walked to another table that was seated after us and took their order. Ok waited long enough, we walked out. Have to admit that is was gutsy on the owners part to chase us down at our car and beg us to give them another try. We did. Again food was awesome, spot on. We had the avocado toast, which was great. I had eggs benedict, very yummy. Hubby had the corned beef, homemade. The minus star is for the growing pains. I hate bad food, but bad service is no fun either. The owners were great. Someone else was not happy and went out yelling. The owner said they can't keep up with the growth and will be hiring more people. We drove from the strip and it was worth it. We will be back.
I'm not a breakfast person but this was THE best I've had! Service was amazing and the chef/owner came out to greet us. Definitely coming back to try the rest of the menu!

First time visiting and it was amazing. Corned beef hash and eggs to die for... with scallion hollandaise sauce!!! Hubby loved his steel cut oatmeal. We're locals and will be back for sure. And...a chef visit and complimentary sample of their kick a$$ bread pudding! Where has this place been all my life? Heard they're opening another on the NW side in April!!! Yes!!

Amazing discovery thanks to Yelp recommendations. I hope they can keep the good service and outstanding food quality. The Collins hamburger was spectacular. Homemade, thick, cooked to perfection, onions, fried egg on a perfect piece of bread.
You may have to drive a few minutes off the strip, but it is worth it.
The only "minus" was that the coffee was not hot enough for me (I like it "boiling" hot ;-)

Well I must be missing something guys. From start to finish it was just ok. Chicken and waffles were average, the waffles tasted a bit doughy but the chicken breast( chicken fingers) were seasoned well.  I specifically asked if they were chicken fingers and was told no it was chicken breast. I asked for a side of jalape√±o bacon however I couldn't get it because it only goes with the shrimp and grits. They did send out a side of the regular slab bacon complimentary(?) while I appreciate the gesture I would have gladly paid for the jalape√±o bacon.  The jazz music was great, the chef came out and talk to every table......except ours  I'm a foodie and would have loved to chat ( the restaurant was not busy).  We travel  a lot and for me when I go to an independent restaurant the little things bring me back. This spot was just not for me.

This was the best little breakfast place! Fancy items too like stuffed crispy eggplant with feta! We ordered 4 different dishes and each one was perfect! They even gave us complimentary warm cookies, chips and some animal crackers for my son! My veggie omelette was not over cooked and had the right amount of seasoning. My mom's breakfast burrito had flavor and spicy homemade salsa to top it off! You gotta try their zuchinni fries and garlic fries, even comes with fancy sauce to dip it in! Oh did I mention my son's fresh cinnamon roll was so gigantic that 4 of us couldn't even finish it! I'm pretty sure the cream was freshly made too!

This is a great little place. My friend and I came here for lunch. The prices are great and the portions are pretty big too. They have plenty of options for breakfast and lunch and they had a few specials as well. We got the smoked salmon plate and the mac and cheese. When we paid they gave us a couple of cookies as complements from the chef :) Will definitely come back!
Excellent place. Food amazing. Good comfort food. Nice relaxing music and excellent service.

This place is BOMB! The Eggs Benedict was the best I've ever had! Good people, good service, all around an excellent place! Surprised with some yummy homemade chips with aioli to start and ambrosia to finish things up. Seriously go here...  you will not be disappointed.

This is absolutely my favorite place in Las Vegas!
Well hidden gem that is quite, has fantastic service, and the best food I have had here in Vegas. The food is so fresh it tastes better than anything else. I highly recommend this place.

Great food and service. I had the shrimp and cheesy grits once and the eggs benedict another time. When one of the eggs came out broken, they insisted on redoing it -- even after I ate it! Wow.

The food is well balanced and hearty. The chef is extremely accommodating to requests. Want a healthier version? No problem.

I've been to several breakfast/brunch places in the area and I recommend this one above all others.
Fantastic food, very reasonably priced, and extremely friendly atmosphere. We can't wait to come back!!
Great service and the food was super delish! Found this gem in the east side of town..and it was worth the trip. Lots of vegan options on their menu can't wait to try them all.

Zenaida's is amazing! I love coming here for the Eggs Benedict. The staff is extremely attentive. The food is fresh and coffee is to die for. I've definitely recommended this place to all my family and friends.

Best cafe I've ever been to! I'll definitely be coming back here whenever I'm in Vegas. Excellent food & service. The chef even comes out to greet his customers. Make sure to try the avocado toast, so many flavors & the bread melts in your mouth

This was a great brunch find! We got off a 5 hour flight... was in search for food and found this cute cafe.  I ordered the homemade corn beef hash and eggs that came with yummy hollandaise sauce, which made it totally amazing! Chef added a special touch with some warm homemade cookies... made us feel real special. 

Food was fresh, tasty, and served hot.  Restaurant was super cute and colorful.  Service was timely and friendly.  Would definitely go back again on this trip.

Customer service was great, chef even came to all the tables to talk about the food quality and apologized for the extra time it took which was very nice of him. Food was exceptional as well, great place to eat !

I love to take my friends and family to new places. My kids are in town took them to Zenaida's for brunch, as we waited for our food my kids said the whole family was going to Weiss Deli tomarrow for brunch! I asked why not HERE! They chimed "tradition". I asked how 12 to 15 people would get seated on a Sunday there. After our brunch today, my son said he wanted to bring the whole family to Zenaida's!! Sunday!   Hers to a new tradition!  
Thanks chief, loved the experience.

This Cafe is one of the reasons why I love Yelp so much. I would have never found it if it wasn't out of curiosity on why this little cafe, in a neighborhood I'm normally not in, had almost 105 star reviews. Also, with a name like Zenaida's, I would have assumed it was another Mexican style restaurant in Las Vegas. But what it is, is a fabulous fusion of bistro meets new American meets comfort-food. 

The staff is so friendly and welcoming. You really do feel like you're part of a cool family that knows how to cook really well. The atmosphere is kind of kitschy and funky. And the little extras that they give you, like the homemade potato chips with aioli at the beginning to the meal and the cookies with cream at the end, really makes it special. 

It's really kid friendly as well. My girlfriend brings her baby and the staff always googles over her and brings her little animal crackers or fruit to enjoy. We never asked for it they are just Johnny-on-the-spot and appears like magic. I highly recommend you check it out  for brunch . Their breakfast and brunch menu is definitely my favorite.

I tried Zenaida's Cafe again several times in the last week and they are still fantastic. I enjoyed the Pork Stack, Corned Beef Hash and Monte Christo. The pork stack probably was the most unique dish and my favorite, but the dishes were all excellent. They still serve complimentary homemade chips before the meal and a chocolate chip cookie at the end. The coffee was strong and hot. The service was timely and attentive without being intrusive. The chef took the time to ask whether I enjoyed his dishes. I wish this business every success and hope that they are earning enough. The portion sizes seem large for the price.
Excellent service, Friendy staff,Beautiful presentation, Delicious Shrimp and cheeezy grits and Avocado Toast

I had an outstanding lunch experience here.  The server and cook were very friendly and enthusiastic.  I had the vegan quinoa burger which contained delicious vegan cheese and avocado and was scrumptious and filling.  The flat bread that enclosed the sandwich was soft and tasty.  The accompanying salad was full of the healthy type of greens and served with a light but tasty vinaigrette dressing. 
The one fault I had was that the server also bussed the tables, but hopefully as the excellent food builds a bigger customer base, the owner will hire a busboy for lunch.  Otherwise, I give this restaurant my highest recommendation!

Came here for breakfast based on great Yelp reviews. Well Yelpers, you did not disappoint! I'm glad that we tried this diamond in the rough. I loved the mom and pop feel of the restaurant. The food presentation keeps up with the modern trend and the taste is even more amazing. We ordered the smoked salmon with Bagel, loved the fixings that came with it. Also ordered a breakfast sandwich with Portuguese sausage (Monte Cristo Sandwich) and that was a good choice! It was very filling. Their burgers are huge and tasty. Their waffles with fresh strawberries also did not disappoint, big portion as well. Love love that they serve homemade chips to start with and they end our meals with super gooey chocolate chip cookies with a side of whipped cream, both complimentary! Staff are super friendly, that's always a bonus. Will definitely be back and recommend to friends.

Really impressed by the fresh quality and beautiful presentation of the food, not to mention the large portions and reasonable prices. Ordered Eggs Benedict, Rib Hash daily special, and half an order of biscuits and gravy. You can taste the fresh ingredients. They really pay attention to how the food is made.

Restaurant located in a regular strip mall; interior is casual and inviting. Restaurant opened 7 months ago. Staff is super friendly. 

Chef Sterling came out to greet all the customers and I told him how much we were enjoying our meal. At the end of the meal we were so stuffed but received as a gift from the chef a decadent dish of soft chocolate chip cookies topped with chantilly cream and strawberries. What a great way to end our meal! 

Will definitely come back every time we are in vegas!

What a pleasant surprise! This is definitely a hidden gem in Las Vegas. It's nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and still enjoy a quality meal. I enjoyed the shrimp and grits while my girlfriend had the breakfast nacho special. It's a very friendly atmosphere and I would recommend everyone to experience this place once.

Hidden gem, family feel, awesome food.
Many locals and returning patrons. 
A little off the beaten path, you will need a car or Uber there.
Will definitely return.

From start to finish it was outstanding. The homemade potato chips,wonderful.
Corned beef hash and eggs were the best I've ever had. Please, take the time to try this hidden gem.

Best breakfast in Vegas. Real loving care given to the food. Real ingredients, not ready made frozen foods. Real thick bacon, real whip cream, great coffee!
Can't wait to go back!
Service is prompt. Food was awesome with quality and deliveries to your table by the chef. You won't be disappointed.

This little hidden gem hidden in a a plaza off Tropicana and pecos is amazing, from the service to almost everything house made to the friendliest chef who if has the time will come check on you and see how your meal was and your day is going. Iv only explored about 1/4th the menu but I plan to try it all. The Clam Chowder in a bread bowl was literally overflowing with chowder and the freshest and perfect amount of clams! The Biscuits and Gravy where on another level get an over easy egg added, it was cooked so perfectly it looked like a freshly snowed on mountain fluffy and pearly white! My favorite breakfast place on the east side of town when I can wake up on time! Lol also they always throw in a free small sample of there desserts!

Went there based on Yelp reviews and I understand why this place is so higly rated. Lots of variety on the menu even for pescatarians, vegetarians and vegans, very reasonable prices especially given the quality of the food and the copious serving, and everybody is incredibly friendly. Lovely place, I will definitely be back!
Food was okay, not the best. But I'll give them a second chance and try chicken and waffles. Will let you guys know.
OMG--new fave breakfast place!!! Great food, great service. Super nice folks. And, as a jazz lover, I'm loving the music on a Sunday morning. So happy I discovered this place!

Had brunch here with my son today. They started us off with some chips and Bloody Mary aioli. They were really good, felt like the aioli was missing something but I didn't need it anyway.
We both ordered omelettes-they were fluffy and hot. I have a comment regarding this though: the menu says you can have 3 items in your omelette but it has no list of choices. 
So I ordered the standard ham and cheese. The chef forgot my ham. So I had eggs and cheese. It was ok. I did point it out and they sent out some warm cookies for us. 
Overall it was good, I enjoyed the jazz music playing. It was comfortable and the people were nice. Don't know that this is my go to breakfast place though. Solid 3 stars.

What I like (love) about this place: the different flavored aioli served every time with the homemade potato chips (I save the aioli for my delicious omelette or eggs), the best bacon (pork slab), their avocado is always perfect, the little treats they bring you at the end, AND the very friendly servers. I'm pretty sure almost everyone is related and they are all nice. I also love the fact that I don't have to drive to the strip and pay for parking. These people know what they are doing. I almost didn't want to write this review because others would find out about it. But, I also want them to stay in business.

I've been to this restaurant about 5-6 times and each time has not disappointed. Their eggs Benedict is one of the best I've ever had and their monte christo is one of my boyfriends favorites. The chef gives us a free desert sometimes and those are on point as well. 5 stars!

We had shrimp and grits and turkey breakfast sandwich. 
The only thing I have to say about this place is the food was a little too greasy. However, the complimentary apple and berry cobbler definitely made up for it, and the fact that the chef came out to greet every table separately made all the difference to me. 
On the other hand, I would have enjoyed the shrimp and grits way better if it had less gravy. The amount of shrimp in it was very generous though ! 
Homemade chips with their homemade aioli sauce really nice touch !!
Family feel with great genuine little touches made this place better in our book! 
This was our contribution to small business Saturday!
Great service. Wonderful food. Awesome chef. This place is a soon to be gem. Well worth the try.

The service these wonderful people provide is outstanding, I can't express the feeling of home that this place will give you once you take your first step into this beautifully put together restaurant all I can say is if there was one place to try in Vegas Zenaida would be my number one recommendation. Much love god bless! 
If I could give you guys 1 billion star rating I sure would!
We were here before the lines. This place will do really well. Very special service and food.

The service was amazing. We were greeted with a smile the minute that we walked in. The waiter was friendly and fast. I ordered the spinach, feta with saut√©ed heirloom tomato's. It was fantastic! My boyfriend ordered the steak omelet. He didn't realize it had pork and asked for the same dish without meat. The chef was wonderful! He asked if chicken would be a good. He even brought out the dish personally! Such great service! I've never felt more welcomed and at home. It's definitely the move the next time I'm in the area.

I know I don't rate a lot and need to get better at it because the only reason I came across Zenaida's is due to yelp!  I've Then coming to Las Vegas for over 20 years on business and I've eaten at so many restaurants. From tiny little local spots to five star restaurants. This possibly goes down as the best experience at a restaurant in Las Vegas. I cannot wait to come back in August and Visit again.

Most excellent customer service I have experienced in all of Las Vegas! Cute charming restaurant, plays smooth jazz while you eat. Came here for breakfast with my fianc√© this morning. I ordered the spinach/feta/grape tomato omelette. He ordered the smoked salmon bagel plate. Both were picture perfect and tasty. We were surprised in the middle of our breakfast that the actual chef himself came to check how we were enjoying our food. Our server was nice too, he checked up on us plenty and refilled my coffee cup multiple times. We really enjoyed our expeeience and will be coming back!
The BEST eggs Benedict I have ever had!  The service was absolutely fantastic and the food was amazing!  Can't wait to try more off the menu!

First time coming here. The hostess and server were both very nice. I ordered the tofu scramble which was delicious and my boyfriend ordered eggs Benedict. The chef came out to say hello to another customer and stopped to make small talk with my boyfriend who was wearing a VGK hat. Very friendly. Before leaving we received two delicious cookies, compliments of the chef. Will definitely be coming back.

Our first time at Zenaida's was a great experience! The service is a 10. The complimentary homemade potato chips with red pepper aioli were a surprise! The chicken and waffles was delicious!  I'm not a fan of country hash browns but they were seasoned  perfectly! The chef came by to see if we had enjoyed the food. Very impressed!

Absolutely loved this place! Visited because it's on our side of town and the other reviews. The biscuits and gravy were huge and delicious. My boyfriend ordered corned beef hash, we suspect the corned beef was not homemade bit I'm still giving 5 stars because the experience as a whole was great. They play jazz and the place has a very laid back atmosphere. The chef also sent us over some complimentary desert at the end and it was delicious.  We can't wait to go back!

Hidden gem for sure! Cozy little spot with an eclectic "grandma's house" feel.

The menu is small, but has a lot of different variety. There are quite a few vegan options too. When I told the waiter I didn't eat pork or beef he suggested I substitute the ham on the eggs benedict for avocado and it was amazing! 

They also brought us free chips with a delicious homemade dipping sauce. At the end of our meal the cook came out and thanked us for coming in, which was super nice. They also gave us two free fresh baked cookies for dessert. The food was delicious and the staff were amazing. Will definitely make this a go to spot when I'm on that side of town.

Went here for breakfast and glad I did.  The service is awesome, the portion size is generous, the prices are right one and the food is super yummy  especially the bacon.  Also the owner came out and said hello and thanked us for visiting.  Thanks Yelp!!! This one was a winner and my new breakfast place.
Best breakfast place for outstanding food. Anyone coming from outside of Vegas must come and have food here. Atmosphere, staff, and cooks are absolutely amazing.
It's approximately 5 miles from Las Vegas strip so traffic flow is slow, to me that is a plus
Totally Recommend. Everything was delicious. Breakfast Stack was so good. My compliments to the Chef. He even came out to check on our table. Give this place a try, you won't regret it!
Wow! The cinnamon roll is the bomb! Great service and good portions. Will make a return to this little gem!

Healthy food choices, generous portions, and reasonable prices. 

The chef came out to chat with the tables. Family run business. Local gold.

Let's start with the Avocado Toast. I had read other reviews describing how awesome it is. Until you try it, you just have no idea what you're missing! Crunchy garlic toast with avocado and heirloom tomatoes with a sliver of red onion. WOW, my taste buds have been forever altered. My wife had the chicken and 
waffles. Seriously, c'mon, are you guys this good at everything? I didn't try the chicken, but the waffles were amazing! Truly worth it just for the waffles alone. But don't forget the Avocado Toast. I had the Mac and Cheese with gator style sausage. I was disappointed, that there wasn't more! I was stuffed about 2/3 the way through it but I just couldn't stop eating that creamy, slightly spicy, bowl of nirvana! I haven't even told you about the cookies the chef sent out when we were done! Real whipped cream, soft, gooey cookies. Still warm! If I lived in Vegas, I'd be here daily, hands down the best place to go and just minutes from the strip! The guys in the kitchen are Gastric Gods! I will be back, even if I have to walk from Colorado!

This place is clean and the owners and staff are extremely nice, polite and helpful.  I did not give 5 stars because I did not like what I ordered.  I had the breakfast burrito and it came out in a green tortilla and was STUFFED with eggs.  They put a sausage link in the middle (not chopped just one long link) and a little cheese but it was so eggy I couldn't eat it.  I'd prefer they cut the meat up, use less eggs and put the potatoes inside.  My husband ordered the Montecristo sandwich and it was excellent.  I would try them again but order something different. Bonus they give you warm chocolate chip cookies at the end of your meal.

The place we were headed didn't open for 20 minutes so we saw Zenaida's was open. Very cute storefront restaurant.   You can see into the kitchen and even listen to the chef give instructions.  That was kinda cool.   He was instructing the line on the quality he expected!  Nice upbeat instrumental music playing.   We got a warm greeting and seated immediately.  Just about everything on the menu looked awesome.  I decided on pancakes and my husband had biscuits and gravy.   But first one of the servers brought out homemade potato chips with a red pepper aioli. That was really yummy!!  The pancakes were really yummy and hallelujah somebody that knows how to cook pancakes!  I am so tired of getting half cooked pancakes!  My husband liked his biscuits and gravy.   The gravy wasn't what he expected since is was a brown gravy instead of light.   But it was really tasty. Oh I forgot to mention SUPER fast service!  Then at the end, our server brought us two little bites of pumpkin bread pudding complements of the chef.  It was really yummy as well. I just love little touches like that.  Really makes you feel like they appreciate their customers. Well done!  And as we leave the chef says thanks, goodbye and Happy New Year through the pass window!

I was looking for something quick to grab the other morning. I saw the reviews on here and decided to give this place a whirl. I walked in and the place doesn't look like much. So there I was hoping it was going to be good.... it was the BEST shrimp and grits I've ever tasted. I also ordered the biscuits and gravy which weren't quite what I expected, but they were still delicious. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a breakfast spot. I will definitely be back for more of it all!!!!

I see why this place has 5 stars  everything was superb from beginning to the very end. Service was excellent and the food was just as great! The chef even came out from kitchen to greet everyone at their tables and ask how the meal was! The ambiance here is very friendly and comfortable. I have lived around here for about 10 years and never knew this existed! Thank you fellow  Yelpers
This restaurant is a hidden gem! Great and delicious food, clean and bright atmosphere too!

Really high level food (and a fair amount of it), especially for the price. You can tell there is a lot of care and pride taken in what they serve - which is what separates a decent place from a spectacular one. Plus - weekly specials, which means you won't be bored coming back.

No wonder this place has 5 stars. Pin pointing what everyone else said: hidden gem and grandma's house.

You would never really know this place was here unless you stumbled upon this parking lot. We, however, found this lovely place on Yelp. Thank you, yelp. It truly is a remarkable place! Home-good feeling, wonderful aromas, a home-town setting. 

Christmas music, happy employees, regular customers. A place you just want to be!

We started off with the cinnamon roll and boy was it out of this world! Sweet cream icing, whipped cream, some sort of drizzle, and berries on top with cinnamon. The smell is something memorable. SO delicious! I've never thought to eat a cinnamon roll with fruits but boy was it yummy! It was pretty big, yet we still ate it all. Our main courses arrived. Jaw dropping! The presentation was perfect and the food even better. Monte Cristo all the wayyy. The sandwiches cut perfectly in the middle. Eggs also very well cooked. Potatoes were how potatoes should be - crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. And everything was just so amazing.

Vegas's best kept secret!  Definitely recommend eating here!!  Great food and presentation.  The Chef takes pride in his cooking!  All four entrees that we had were excellent.  Earned all five stars!!

Came down because of the reviews on yelp, brought hubbie as well.

Ordered the pork loin stack and eggs Benedict. Both were great. The pork loin had heat but it was a nice heat. Also....the eggs on the Benedict had that perfect pop when you break the yolk. The potatoes had a good crisp crunch. 

We both cleaned our plates. 

Staff were all friendly, including the chef who came out to meet us.

The only down side was the decaf was instant.  But it wasn't enough to downgrade and didn't take away from the meal significantly. We just couldn't drink regular that morning as one of us works a graveyard shift and would be going to bed soon. 

The chef sent out a surprise gratis dessert of apple berry cobbler. It had a great taste and texture. There were bits of sugar crunch like you find on a creme brulee. Yum!

2 entrees, and 2 coffees with tax and tip came to $36.
